loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is married and blessed with two children. They live in the village of San Marcelo. Marisa raises pigs for sale. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed and vaccine to care for her pigs well. Her goal is to expand her pig-raising business to maintain her income and support the needs of her family. Marisa said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine to support her business

loans.name: Andy

texts.en: To provide for his family’s needs, a young father named Andy committed himself to farming. He has been managing this source of income for five years, but he is more eager to produce higher yields now. He wants to add up his capital in order to meet a greater income and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. Through these inputs, he knows that he can yield better crops to fulfill his obligation to his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: En un lugar ubicado a orillas del mar habita Marlene, mujer de 54 años, casada y madre de un joven de 24 años de edad. Ella es comerciante de ropa, calzado, accesorios y en general la mercancía que su clientela demande y solicite, para ella responder con un inventario diverso, dándole la opción al cliente, de escoger lo que le gusta y a la medida. Cuando inició este negocio, hace 8 años, su esposo le dio el primer capital semilla para invertir y distribuir entre una clientela doméstica, a familiares, vecinos y amigos, clientela que ha ido creciendo, debido a su buen trato y porque es muy referida por sus actuales compradores; sus principales líneas de productos, son los pantalones para damas caballeros y niños, camisas, suéteres, calzado, perfumería etc. Los cuales  vende a crédito y de contado, trabajando durante 12 horas diarias sin cesar. Sus preferencias de compra, son en los almacenes mayoristas ubicados en la zona comercial de la ciudad. Marlene tiene como metas principales, remodelar su negocio, abrir un local al público, fidelizar completamente a su clientela y ahorrar, para disfrutar sus utilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará pantalones, jeans, camisas, perfumes, pues requiere aprovechar la temporada mas comercial del año, para ganar un poco mas trabajando fuertemente y finalmente cumplir sus sueños de prosperidad.  .
texts.en: Marlene lives by the ocean.  She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of a 24-year-old son.  She sells clothing, shoes, accessories and in general whatever merchandise her customers ask for.  She tries to provide a varied inventory, so that her customers can choose what they like.  When she started this business 8 years ago her husband provided the seed capital to invest in products to distribute amongst a customer base of family, neighbors and friends.  This customer base has grown, due to her good treatment and because of references from existing buyers.  Her main product lines are pants for women, men and children, shirts, sweaters, shoes, perfume, etc.  She sells on credit and for cash, and works 12 hours a day without a break. She prefers to buy from wholesale warehouses in the commercial zone of the city.  Marlene's principal goals are to restructure her business, to open a store, to ensure the loyalty of her customers, and to save money, so as to enjoy the fruits of her labors.  She is applying for her first Kiva loan now through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy pants, jeans, shirts and perfumes.  She needs to take advantage of the biggest commercial season of the year, in order to earn a bit more by working hard and to finally achieve her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy pants, jeans, shorts and perfume.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: Sra. soledad de 30 años soltera y con  2 hijos, la Sra. soledad  se dedica ya hace 2 años a la venta de ropa  para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia y poder pagar los colegios de sus hijos con el esfuerzo que tiene de salir adelante ,  la Sra. Soledad   ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropas para seguir progresando y así poder tener más ingresos. Ah la Sra. Soledad es la  segunda de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su casaca de color blanco con mangas de color negro A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: Soledad is 30 years old, single and has two children.  Soledad has been selling women’s and men’s clothing from a small shop every day for two years so she can get ahead and help her family and pay for her children’s schooling.  Soledad has improved her finances and quality of life.  Her greatest dream is for her children to become professionals.  She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing so she can continue making progress and increase her income.  Soledad is the second from the left, dressed in white with black sleeves.  She sends a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo and is grateful for the loan because it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy clothing,

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. María se gana la vida mediante la elaboración de variedad de platillos los cuales vende en el mercado de su localidad. Muchas personas prefieren su comida ya que ofrece excelente calidad y buenos precios. Desea invertir en su negocio con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda ya que muchas veces se ha quedado desbastecida y en vista de esto ha pensado en aprovechar dicha oportunidad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de la materia prima como: carnes, pollo, verduras, frijoles, arroz, aceite, etc. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old and has been living in a home of her own with her family for a long time.  Maria earns a living making a variety of dishes, which she sells in the local market.  Many people prefer to buy from her because she offers excellent quality and good prices.  She wants to invest into her business and cover an increased demand that at times leaves her sold out and she has thought about taking advantage of this opportunity.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy meats, chicken, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, etc.  She says that she has the means to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: El grupo “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Blanca la cual cuenta con una librería hace más de 05 años, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito, pues comprará útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, fólderes y borradores. El deseo de Blanca es de seguir implementando su negocio. Blanca de 30 años es  casada con 01 hijo aún dependiente. El grupo “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Blanca se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho viste polo celeste la podemos apreciar con  su hija.
texts.en: The “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” group is made up of seven enterprising women who are looking to improve daily.  Blanca tells us that she has had a bookstore for more than five years and it has allowed her to improve her home.  She is asking for a loan so she can buy school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, folders, and erasures.  Blanca wants to continue implementing her business.  She has been married for 30 years and has a daughter.  The “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” group is grateful for those who made this loan possible.  Blanca is seated on the right, wearing a polo shirt and has her daughter with her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Maribel de 32 años  es soltera con 01 hijo dependiente, actualmente es socia del grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” constituida por 06 socios trabajadores que pasan a su 2do ciclo. Maribel cuenta con un puesto la cual ofrece  postres como mazamorra morada, arroz con leche, mazamorra de calabaza, entre otras delicias. Gracia a su esfuerzo Maribel puede seguir apoyando a su menor hijo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de insumos como leche, azúcar, arroz, calabaza  y canelas.  Poner otro puesto de postres es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Maribel se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado derecho y vistes blusa plomo con rayas blancas.
texts.en: Maribel is 32 years old, single and has a son.  She is a member of the “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” group, made up of six hardworking members in their second cycle.  Maribel has a shop where she offers desserts such as porridge, rice pudding, pumpkin porridge, and other delicacies.  Thanks to her efforts, Maribel can continue supporting her young son.  She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients such as milk, sugar, rice, pumpkins, and cinnamon.  Setting up another point of sale is her greatest desire.  The “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance.  Maribel is seated and the second from the right wearing a grey blouse with white stripes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Pandachin, una zona rural del distrito Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente el cultivo de café, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno, cuenta con invernas propias donde cría su ganado vacuno, también se dedica a la agricultura de de café y cultivos de pan llevar , es un padre emprendedor anteriormente ya había solicitado un préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa que le ayudo en su negocio, ahora el ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de ganado vacuno y posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo en el Puerto de Chiple que es el lugar donde se comercializa este tipo de ganado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Augusto is 50 years old, and lives with his wife and children in Caserio de Pandachin, a rural area of the Canaris district.  This district is located in the province of Ferrenafe, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  People in this region work primarily in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  Augusto works raising and selling cattle.  He has his own pastures where he raises his cattle.  He also grows coffee and staple food crops.  He is an enterprising father who has previously requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa which helped him in his business.  He is now requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to invest in  buying cattle and then fattening them and selling them in the port of Chiple, which is the principal marketplace for cattle.  In this way he hopes to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to sell them later at a higher price.

loans.name: Dúo Tu En Mi Group

texts.es:
Dúo Tú En Mí
Este Dúo está conformado por Natalia es originaria del municipio de San Martin Jilotepeque, se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como lo son: gallinas, pollos, vacas,  marranos, y bordados y tejidos típicos,es una mujer luchadora que se esfuerza pos darle lo mejor a sus hijos y el sueño de ella es poder tener ingresos para seguir dando estudio a sus hijos. es responsable en sus pagos y solicita el crédito para comprar animales, concentrado y telas para bordar y tejer.
texts.en:
Dúo Tú En Mí

Natalia is part of this duo.  She is from the town of San Martin Jilotepeque and raises corral animals such as chickens, cows, pigs, and also does typical knitting and weavings.  She is a hardworking woman who works to provide her children with what they need and her dream is to be able to have income to continue providing for her children’s education.  She is responsible with her payments and is asking for a loan to buy animals, concentrated feed, and fabric to embroider and knit.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Minia

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su querido esposo desde hace mucho tiempo. María es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Tiene 13 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de antojitos típicos como: pupusas, enchiladas, tamales, pasteles de carne y yuca frita. Tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más ya que ofrece productos de buena calidad y a muy buenos precios. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios ( yuca, maíz, frijoles, quesos, verduras, aceite, etc.) para cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado y así poder aumentar  las ventas y por consecuencia sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old and lives in a home of her own with her long time loving husband.  Maria is an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman who has been making typical food, such as pupusas, enchiladas, tamales, meat pies, and fried yucca for 13 years.  She has many customers who prefer to buy from her each day because of her good quality and good prices.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy ingredients such as yucca, corn, beans, cheeses, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.) so she can cover her increased market demand, and be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que ele han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, como arroz al por mayor, azúcar, fideos, entre otros productos con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio, sobre todo porque es temporada navideña y de esta manera atenderá mejor a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas, lo cual le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una distribuidora de alimentos”.
texts.en: Hector is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help he has been able to buy merchandise, such as sugar, noodles, and other products in quantity for his small grocery and beverage business, with which he can stock his store because it’s the Christmas season and he will be better able to serve his customers and improve his sales.  He will be able to continue working toward reaching his great dream, “To have a food distributorship.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dúo Villa Lobos Group

texts.es: Dúo Villa Lobos, el señor Mynor de 27 años de edad,se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta, esperando que le puedan ayudar ya que en este tiempo de fin de año sus ventas aumentan y es muy buen tiempo para crecer un poco mas en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Villa Lobos Duo
Mynor is 27 years old and has worked for several years selling food products.  He is requesting a loan to buy food products to sell.  He hopes that you can help him, because during this season at the end of the year his sales increase, and it is a good time to grow his business a bit more.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Gabriel

texts.es: Manuel está agradecido por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar enseres para su hogar, ya que actualmente no se encuentran en buenas condiciones, de esta manera el podrá salir a trabajar más tranquilo, sobre todo porque tiene un pequeño hijo el cual necesita vivir en mejores condiciones, de esta manera el seguirá trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena  educación a su pequeño hijo”.
texts.en: Manuel is grateful for the support and opportunity he is getting from the Kiva lenders because now he can buy fixtures for his house since they are currently in bad shape.  Now he can be more relaxed when he goes out to work.  Above all, he has a small child who needs to live under better conditions.  In this way he can continue working and striving to make his dream a reality, “To provide a good education for his son.”

loans.use: to buy household fixtures.

loans.name: Dúo Vista Hermosa De Patzun Group

texts.es:
Dúo vista hermosa de patzun
la señora Delfina  de 34 años de edad vive en patzun Chimaltenango,se ha dedicado  al negocio le gusta trabajar luchar por su familia, por tres años  ha solicitado crédito a Fape/KIVA  y eso le ha ayudado  mucho ya que  cada vez  que se le otorga su crédito  ella invierte en su negocio que es tienda de trajes típicos,
su  sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos que ellos crezcan darle estudio  para que cuando sean grandes  tengan oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dúo Vista Hermosa de Patzun

Delfina is 34 years old and lives in Patzun Chimaltenango, has a business and strives for her family.  She has been asking for loans through Fape/Kiva for three years and they have helped her very much because she invests in her business, typical outfits of clothing, each time she gets a loan.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children so that they will grow up and be educated so they will have better opportunities to get ahead when they grow up.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrtio de Zaña, que se encuentra cerca al valle del Río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse en la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores borregos, patos, pavos, conejos, cuyes desde hace más de 10 años, Luzmila se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de animales patos, pavos y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor producción de animales para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Luzmila is 68 years old and lives with her husband in the Zana district, which is located near the Rio Jequetepeque valley, in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  People in this area work in agriculture and livestock.  Luzmila has worked for more than 10 years raising and selling small animals such as lambs, ducks, turkeys, rabbits and guinea pigs.  She does this work to support her husband with the household expenses, and is an enterprising mother.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals such as ducks and turkeys, and balanced feed to fatten them, and thus to offer her customers a better product and to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals and balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Eduardo, quien con su credikiva anterior logró comprar materias primas como pollo, carne, cerdo, jamón, chorizo, salsas y aderezos, con los que preparó los más deliciosos perros calientes, hamburguesas, entre otros productos y deleito a su clientela, que muy pronto acabaron con sus inventarios. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmado, porque  su negocio mejoró, se incrementaron sus ventas y sus utilidades, por eso ha vuelto a solicitar un financiamiento, porque aprovechará la gran demanda de la temporada, mediante la cual aspira a hacer sus mejores ventas de fin de año. Esta es la razón por la cual su inversión, la presume como muy exitosa, pues con ella comprará salsas, aderezos, carne vacuna y porcina, en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos y salir adelante rápidamente.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Eduardo, who used his last Kiva loan to buy basic ingredients such as chicken, beef, pork, sausage, sauces and dressings with which to make the most delicious hot dogs, hamburgers and other products to delight his customers so that he soon ran short of inventory.  He is now very enthusiastic because his business has improved, and his sales and profits have increased.  For this reason he has now returned to request a loan, in order to take advantage of the great seasonal demand, with which he hopes to makes his best sales at the end of the year.  This is the reason for his investment, which he assumes will be very successful, as he will use it to buy sauces, dressings, beef and pork in larger quantities in order to obtain a discount and to quickly get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sauces, dressings, beef and pork in larger quantities.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: “EL SOL DE CUPICHE”  es uno de los grupos puntuales en sus cuotas. Los socios del mencionado grupo se dedicada al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios en diversas aéreas. Aydee  tiene 29 años es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica al a venta de ropa para niños solo a pedido de sus clientes fidelizados y algunos clientes externos. Años atrás vendía ropa para adultos ella cambio el giro de su negocio ya que la venta de ropa de adultos no le generaba mucha ganancia que a diferencia que con la de venta de ropa para niños obtiene mejores ganancias. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de polos short gorras. Ella implementara su negocio con la venta de zapatos y zapatillas para niños En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. En el  grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Aydee es la tercera del lado derecho viste casaca fucsia.
texts.en: “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” is one of the groups on time with their payments.  The members are small business people and provide services in various areas.  Aydee is 29 years old and lives with her dependent son.  She sells children’s clothing, but only to order to her loyal customers and a few others.  Years ago she sold adults’ clothing, but she changed her business because adult clothing didn’t generate as much profit as children’s.  She will use the money from this loan to buy polo shirts, shorts, and hats.  She will add children’s shoe and slipper sales to her business.  She is the group’s president and is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their loan.  Aydee is the third from the right, wearing a fuchsia top.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, aged 36, is married and a loving mother of six children who still depend on her income. To make a living, Phal and her husband help each other to manage a farming business, which is a traditional family business and is the major source of income for the family. Having been in the business for nearly 20 years, she can earn a decent income for the family’s daily needs.

At the moment, she wants a loan to buy an ox for the maintenance of the rice fields. With the loan, Phal will be able to reduce farming costs incurred by hiring animals from locals and hopes to make her business more productive in the coming season.  Phal always finds ways to improve her farm, to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy an ox for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
EDITH ESTHER, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Mercedes", formado por seis socias. Es un grupo recién formado unidas por la necesidad de generar ingresos extras, apoyar a sus parejas con los gastos de la casa y salir adelante mediante un trabajo honrado.
Desde hace aproximadamente tres años Edith Esther se dedica a la venta de fruta en un mercado de su zona, inició éste negocio con lo idea de solo trabajar un tiempo, pero ya que le fue bien decidió seguir.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de javas de fruta para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
EDITH ESTHER is 38 years old and has two young children.  She is a member of the “Las Mercedes” group, made up of six members.  It’s a newly formed group and united out of a need to generate extra income to support their husbands with the household expenses and get ahead through honest work.

Edith Esther has been selling fruit in the area market for about three years.  She began this business with the idea of only working a short time, but things went well so she decided to continue.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fruit so she can offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry  se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, donde todas ponen su mayor predisposición para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas ponen su mayor esfuerzo por mejorar y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Venancia, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella comenta que siempre ayuda a sus compañeras y también las insta a seguir trabajando y luchando como lo vienen haciendo. Ella por su parte vende prendas variadas, y con ese trabajo ayuda a su familia y trata de darles todo para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Pide este préstamo como un medio de invertir en su emprendimiento, ya que quiere comprar prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a  sus clientes.
texts.en: Kuna Katupyry is made up of a group of friends and neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa, where they make their best efforts to help each other.  They are part of the poverty-elimination program, in which they all try their hardest to improve and grow.  One of the members is Venancia, who is the president.  She says that she always helps her colleagues and urges them to keep on working and struggling as they have been doing.  She sells a variety of clothing, and with this work she helps her family and tries to give them everything, so that they will lack nothing.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her inventory, because the hot season is coming and she would like to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Pandachi una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maíz, yuca y principalmente cafe, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra y de esta manera tener una mejor producción en cuanto a calidad para ofrecer a buen precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Ceferino is 41 years old, and lives with his wife and children in Caserio be Pandachu, a rural zone in the Canaris disctrict, which is located in the province of Ferrenafe.  This province belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern cost of Peru.  People in this rural zone work at agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  Ceferino works in agriculture, growing corn, yucca and primarily coffee, and has about 10 years experience in this field.  He is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain his crops, by buying manure and paying laborers.  In this way he hopes to increase the quality of his product, which he will sell at a good price to his customers and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure to maintain his crop and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, makeup tools, and electronics for her salon.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Nablus. One of his children attends primary school. Nablus is a city in the northern West Bank, approximately 49 kilometers north of Jerusalem, with a population of 126,132. 

Emad does not have enough money to do some work in his house so he applied for a loan to improve the house and make it better. He wants to extend the plumbing and install doors, which will help to warm the house, especially now that it is winter.

Emad said that this loan will help him a lot and he is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to extend the plumbing and install doors in his house

loans.name: Sahei Lom Group

texts.en:
“God is the provider and it is amazing how the provider provides for the needy”, was the word from Hatnem. She is the sole breadwinner in the family and a staunch believer in the divine. She is one of the members of the Sahei Lom Group and the featured borrower. She is pictured with her hand raised. Her husband manages the house and takes care of the family affairs.
 
Vegetable selling is her main business to generate income. She gets the vegetables from cultivators at cheaper rates and sells them in the nearby town market shed and once in a while, she also sells them in the capital market in Imphal. Her business requires frequent traveling since the suppliers stay in the village and she has to go there to get the vegetables. She sells vegetables according to the season, which helps to continue her rolling income. At the beginning, she used to share the profits because the capital money was equally distributed among the business partners. After she joined this group, she managed to start her own business, which enables her to earn more income.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase a variety of seeds to supply to as many cultivators as possible. She says cultivators favor those who can provide them seeds and saplings in bounty when they really need them because it is difficult for them to buy seeds and saplings due to a shortage of money. When the vegetables are ready to be sold, the cultivators give them priority in respect to distribution of the vegetables. They get more supplies than those random vegetable vendors who do not supply seeds at the beginning.

She is glad that she can fulfil her next business cycle without asking for money from the money lenders at a high interest. She will try her best to repay the loan as she always did with her previous loans. She says, “Thank you so much Kiva”. She wishes to continue the relationship with Kiva and WSDS,  she says with full enthusiasm.
 
The rest of the group members are engaged in garment selling, operating a tea hotel,  supplying water, operating a paan shop, selling vegetables, and operating a piggery.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    TIESSIRI   est constitué de  5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles   dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  des tubercules, d’oignon et de pagnes à l’image de AMI qui est la 2éme femme   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group consists of five married women who on average are 29 years old with three children. They live in traditional families in the Torakabougou area of ​​the city of Bougouni.

They met through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity so they can improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their first loan.

This group of women trades tubers, onions and pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) like AMI who is the second woman in the photo from right to left.

She intends to use her loan to buy 15 lengths of pagnes from wholesalers in Sikasso. She conducts her retail sales at the market and from home, against cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 53, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married and father to his children. By the grace of God, he has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continue to send his children to school to finish their degree.

Romeo oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the jeepney, and renew his registration.

Romeo hopes to have another jeepney unit and dreams that his children will finish their studies.  He meets up with his fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines fight off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfiinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: El Taller Del Maestro Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas es Blanca tiene la edad de 21 años, casada, con un hijo, su negocio es un taller de zapatería que tiene desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus sandalias en Rivas. Tiene 1 año de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales como pega amarilla, pega blanca, charol, suelas, forro, royal, fibra, flores. Saida tiene la edad de 49 años su negocio es la venta de dulce, Regina de 22 años su negocio  es la venta de verduras.
texts.en:
This group consists of three hard-working members, one of which is Blanca. She is 21 years old, married and has one son. She has been running a shoe workshop for the past 10 years and sells her sandals in the city of Rivas. She has been a client of the institution for one year, and is requesting the loan in order to buy materials such as yellow and white glues, patent leather, soles, lining, linen, fibre, and flowers.

Saida is 49 years old and runs a business selling sweets. Regina is 22 years old and runs a business selling vegetables.

loans.use: to buy materials such as yellow and white glues, patent leather, soles, lining, linen, fibre, and flowers.

loans.name: Gisagara Group

texts.fr:
J. Claude fait partie du groupe Gisagara et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 36 ans et est marié à  Acqueline, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  âgés de  1  à 13 ans, dont 3 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, maїs,..) depuis 3  ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  100kg de haricot, 100kg de riz, et 100kg de maїs à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter  un champ de palmiers à huile et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
J. Claude is a member of the Gisagara group and lives in Rumonge. He is 36 years old and married to Acqueline, a trader. Together they have six children, aged between 1 and thirteen years old. Three of the children are in school.  

J. Claude has been running a shop (selling beans, rice, maize, etc.) for three years. 

This is his first loan from Turame. This KIVA loan will increase his capital and help him buy 100kg of beans, 100kg of rice and 100kg of maize, which he will resell in order to make more money.

In the years to come, J. Claude would like to buy a palm grove and see his children study.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy 100kg of beans, 100kg of rice and 100kg of maize to resell in order to make more money

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de  7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3eme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de 
médicaments traditionnels à l’image de ASSETOU qui est la seule assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200 bouteilles de médicaments traditionnels avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of seven married women who on average are 33 years old with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of the City of Bougouni.

They met through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial ability to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their third loan. The two previous loans have been repaid.

This group of women trade traditional medicines like Assétou, who is the only one seated in the photo.

She intends to use the loan to buy 200 bottles of traditional medicines from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and from her home, against cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy traditional medecines

loans.name: Doni-Doni Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DONI-DONI ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SIENSO dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
 Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, de la restauration et des habillements.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DONI-DONI sont à leur 6 eme prêt solidaire. ALIMATA, 1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 litres d’huile, 10 kg d’ognons, 10 paquets de cube Maggi, 10 kg de sel et de 50 kg de riz et 20 kg de fonio pour son restaurant.  Elle s’approvisionne  à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Doni-Doni Group average 36 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Sienso, in San Cercle, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. Their businesses consists in buying and selling various products, such as clothes, and running restaurants.

After having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Doni-Doni Group are now seeking their sixth solidarity loan (group loan).

Alimata is the woman on the right in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 liters of cooking oil, 10 kg of onions, 10 packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, 10 kg of salt, 50 kg of rice, and 20 kg of fonio (a kind of millet) for her restaurant.

She gets her supplies in San, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 416), to be used to cover healthcare, food, clothing, and school expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, onions, bouillon cubes, salt, rice and millet for her restaurant

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  NINA dans le cercle de TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
 Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et divers.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur 4 eme prêt solidaire. AMI, femme debout au milieu sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 tonne d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne  sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Sabougnouma Group average 29 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Nina, in Tominian Cercle, Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. Their businesses consists in buying and selling cereals and other products. After having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Sabougnouma Group are now seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Ami is the woman in the center of the standing row in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy one ton of peanuts. She gets her supplies locally, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 416), to be used to cover healthcare, food, clothing, and school expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy one ton of peanuts

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DJIGUIYA   est constitué de  5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6me prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   d’habillements à l’image de MASSITAN qui est la femme   assise par devant   dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 pagnes Univax avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group consists of five married women who on average are 27 years old with one child. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of the City of Bougouni.

They met through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial ability to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution  where they are on their sixth loan. The five previous loans have been repaid.

This group of women is in the business of retail clothing like Massitan who is the woman sitting in front in the photo. 

She intends to use the loan to buy 25 Univax pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and from her home, against cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 25,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Dúo Enrriqueta Group

texts.es: Dúo Enrriqueta, la señora Karla de 42 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The Dúo Enrriqueta Group includes Karla, 42, who is a hard-working person who runs a grocery store.  She has been in business for several years and is requesting a loan to buy goods to stock her store.  She hopes you will be able to help her with the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cora Maurelina

texts.es:
Cora Maurelina habita en Nueva Guinea, es casada, madre de un niño de un año, labora como docente de secundaria.

Solicita el crédito para realizar compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la sala de su vivienda, de esta forma mejorará la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar, su mayor deseo es mejorar su propiedad y tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Cora Maurelina lives in Nueva Guinea.  She is married, the mother of a one-year-old son and works as a secondary school teacher.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to fix up her living room.  This will improve the family's quality of life.  Her greatest desire is to improve her property and make it safer.

loans.use: To fix up her living room.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Angélica tiene 63 años es casada. Ser socia del grupo “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Hace 40 años se dedica a la venta de materiales para renovar calzados. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de suelas tintes pegamentos hebillas tacones. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Angélica es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste casaca azul y polo verde.
texts.en:
Angélica, 63, is married and belongs to the "LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO" communal bank group which has helped her to improve her income.  For 40 years she has been selling materials for shoe repair.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy soles, dye, heels, buckles and glues.  

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Angélica is the third woman from the left in a blue jacket and green shirt.

loans.use: To buy soles, heels, buckles and glue.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en el Caserío Vista Alegre, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes tiene un relieve accidentado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando café desde hace siete años, es un padre emprendedor que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de su cultivo con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 27, lives with his wife and son in the Vista Alegre rural community in the district of Callayuc.  It is known for its green forests and rugged terrain.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Alfredo is a farmer who has grown coffee for the last seven years.  He is an enterprising father who, alongside his wife, works hard on the job.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN for crop maintenance.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop and hire workers.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 42 años de edad vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras soya y gaseosas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 300 nuevos soles para la compra de tomate, cebolla, pepino, gaseosa, para ampliar su negocio y su respectiva venta atendiendo la demanda de su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 42, lives in the district of Cayaltí where the local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells vegetables, soy and sodas.  Her business is set up at home and she is a very enterprising woman.  The loan she is requesting in the amount of 1,300 PEN will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, cucumbers and sodas to expand her business.  This way she will be able to meet the demand in her community and generate more income to lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy oniones, tomatoes and fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 27 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo, que gracias a las capacitaciones y charlas en las que participan mejoraron bastante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, y gracias al cual han mejorado mucho.
Una persona que se destaca en este grupo es la Sra. Joaquina, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que todas ponen su mayor esfuerzo siempre, que se ayudan y asi están mejorado su estilo de vida. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, y comenta que se dedica a la costura, ya que es modista, y que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, e hilos para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprededoras" is in its 27th loan cycle through the women entrepreneurs program.  It is an old group which, through training and workshops, has allowed the members to improve considerably.  They also participate in the povery elimination program which has helped them too.

One of the members who stands out in the group is Joaquina, the president.  She says the members always work their hardest to help each other and improve their lifestyles.  She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She is a seamstress and is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados chanfainita, hígado, caldo verde, chaufa entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de la zona, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de platos descartables, cubiertos, vasos, servilletas entre otros y de esta manera tener el servicios de cocina disponible para despachar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa, 23, lives with her husband and son in the district of Cayalti.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells food such as chainfainita (cooked pork in sauce), liver, green consomé, and fried rice and meat, among other dishes.  Her stand is located in the local market.  She is an enterprising mother who is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy disposable plates, utensils and napkins to serve the food she makes.

loans.use: To buy disposable plates and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion, 50, a resident of Maliba, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Melecio, a jeepney driver and they have children. She manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Salvacion operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

Salvacion hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: En el año 2003, con la necesidad de aportar ingresos para su hogar y apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, hasta ese momento solo en manos de su cónyuge, quien había perdido su trabajo, Luz Estela, mujer de 36 años y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años, decidió aprovechar todo el conocimiento de panadería, que por herencia tenia su cónyuge y emprendió su propia aventura emprendedora, elaborando y vendiendo productos de panadería.  Hoy tiene una gran oferta de productos deliciosos, entre croissant, galletas, tornillos rellenos, panochas y diversidad de panes que ofrece al público, en su propio domicilio, vendiendo tienda a tienda, de contado y a crédito. Su horario laboral es desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, todos los días de la semana sin cesar. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local, para desagregar su espacio familiar, de su tarea productiva diaria y ofrecer un mayor confort a sus hijos en su vivienda y sacarlos adelanté en sus estudios. Pero su mayor desafío es obtener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para afrontar la demanda y esta es justamente la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo, huevos, queso, vitina, frutas cristalizadas, entre otros insumos, para hacer su mayor oferta  en la temporada de fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades, haciendo así, de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luz Estela, 36, is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15.  In 2003, she had to start working in order to help cover household expenses because her husband, who had been the sole income earner, lost his job.  She decided to take advantage of her baking knowledge, which came form her husband, and started her own baking business.

Nowadays, she sells a wide range of delicious products including croissants, cookies, cream-puffs, and other pastries.  She sells from home and also to stores, on both a cash and credit basis.  Her work schedule is 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day of the week.  Her goal is to have her own shop, away from the home so her children are more comfortable and able to study.

Her greatest challenge is having enough capital to meet the demand for her products.  So, she is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy flour, eggs, cheese, shortening, candied fruits, etc. to have more stock for the New Year season.  It is a time when both sales and profits increase, making the CrediKiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, shortening, candied fruit, etc.

loans.name: Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALMERAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras y enaguas (fondos de faldas), venta de leche, venta de ganado, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yola es integrante, ella indica que hace es el segundo ciclo  que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su matrimonio decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de alimento para ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Palmeras" communal bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Copacabana regional office. This group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which has Yola as its president. The members have various types of businesses, including: selling skirts and petticoats, selling milk, selling cattle and selling cheese.

This loan will benefit the small businesses that are owned by the members of Yola's group. Yola tells us that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer. She joined the organisation following an invitation from one of the representatives went to visit her at home. Yola currently has a business selling milk. She says that she learned this trade from her parents and that this was the family business. After marrying, Yola decided to start her own business.

This loan will be used to increase working capital, by buying cattle feed from the communities in the La Paz department. The feed will be used for her animals and Yola will later sell their milk. This work allows Yola to earn an income to support her family. She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Yola replies that she likes the savings offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre emprendedor y luchador de  37 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es la compra y venta de frutas en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 10 años. Tiene 2 años de ser cliente de la institución tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser un cliente muy cumplido en sus pagos. Está solicitando nuevamente crédito para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en: José is an enterprising and feisty man of 37 years old old. He has a partner, and two children in his care. José has had a business buying and selling fruits at the Masaya market for ten years. He has been with the lending organisation for two years. During this time he has always repaid his loans on time. José is applying for a new loan in order to buy tamarind harvests.

loans.use: to buy tamarind harvests.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesus María tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío La Toma, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Piura y Región del mismo nombre, ubicado en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, Jesus se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compra mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus María is 35 years old. She lives with her husband in the village of La Toma, a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires where the people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It belongs to the province of Piura and region of the same name and is located on the northern coast of Perú. 

She sells groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, beans and more. Her business is located at home. Jesus is engaged in this work in order to support her husband with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in order to buy merchandise to stock her business in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a 59-year-old who focused himself on his farming business. He needs to be determined in his business in order to gain more profits.

Now he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used in promoting his farming business. It would be utilized to purchase four bags of fertilizers, insecticides and two sacks of seeds. These inputs are great in developing his business that will possibly bestow on him and his family a higher income. Hopefully lenders will approve his desired loan.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizers, insecticides and two sacks of seeds

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Maria Editha is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of three grown children from Loon, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog raising business and takes orders for grocery items from the people in her area. Purchasing with cards is an alternative for buying groceries without needing to use money. She stands as a guarantor for all the purchases made by her clients using the cards and they will pay her within a certain period of time.

Ma. Editha wants to buy additional piglets to raise. In the future, Ma. Editha hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is aged 45.  She is a vegetable vendor who sells a variety of vegetables in their community.

Due to insufficient funds, she is asking for a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy squash, string beans and eggplant to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase squash, string beans and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesus está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, por lo que cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación en la que cada una esta.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando cada vez más su situación, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es modista, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra.  Claudia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas en general, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Niño Jesus group is in the “Poverty Stoplight” program and all of them are doing the survey to eliminate poverty in order to know the situation of each one.

One of the members is Claudia who through her struggles and unceasing work and application of the vital behavior of a successful woman, is improving her situation, and is aware that this work and struggle that she has been going through must be permanent and ongoing to achieve total success, so that she will be able to provide better wellbeing for her family.

Besides the work that she does as a dressmaker, also to be highlighted is the work of the advisors who continuously oversee the training and measure the progress while at the same time encouraging the women to fight to overcome poverty.

Claudia is asking for this loan in order to buy fabrics which will help her finalize her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy several fabrics to be used in her sewing business

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: Angela tiene 33 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Originaria de la ciudad de Teustepe, Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Desde muy niña comenzó a elaborar tortillas, ya que le ayudaba a su mama, debido a que  eran una familia de  pocos recursos económicos. Tiempo después decide tener su propio negocio. Desde hace varios años trabaja en la elaboración y venta de tortillas, permitiéndole salir adelante con sus hijos. Su meta próxima es incrementar su negocio. Solicita un crédito para comprar harina de maíz al por mayor y leña, con el fin de incrementar la producción de su producto. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y podrá obtener más ganancias.  Su plan futuro es extender su local.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is originally from the city of Teustepe, Boaco. 

She is a merchant who makes and sells tortillas. She has been making tortillas since she was a child, as she used to help her mother since they were a family with scarce financial resources. Later she decided to open her own business. She has been working making and selling tortillas for some years allowing her to raise her children. Her next goal is to increase her business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy cornmeal in bulk and firewood, in order to increase the production of her product. She thinks that the loan will be very helpful for increasing her sales and obtaining more income. Her future plan is to expand her facility.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal in bulk and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase the yields of sorghum, millet and maize

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is a married woman and a mother of two grown children from Antequera, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Porferia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soda, soap, toiletries, candies and snack foods. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of products in her store thus attracting more buyers. In the future Porferia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soda, soap, toiletries, candies and snack foods

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is 52 years old and he lives with his wife and his seven children in Gaza. He has a small grocery and this is the only source of income for his family.

His house was damaged by the war, so he applied for this loan to repair his house, especially the windows, which will help them to take a step forward. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best for their lives.

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house, especially the windows, because it was damaged by the war

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 39 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife.

For the past two years, he has run his own grocery store which helped him in gathering money and funds his marriage. He sells different kinds of foodstuffs like soft drinks and kids' stuff.  He hopes that this loan will allow him to buy a refrigerator and shelves. He plans to open a supermarket in the future. 

Jamal is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and shelves for his grocery

loans.name: Pa Bong 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 29 years old. She has been doing several jobs such as raising poultry and cattle and working on the rice paddies. Thanh also has to take care of her family of 6 members. She has two kids: one is in kindergarten and one of them was just born 3 weeks ago. Regardless of her health condition, Thanh has to return to work on the field in order to feed her family. 

This is her 4th loan cycle with ACE and she wants to use her loan of 5,000000 VND to buy wood to rebuild her downgraded house as well as fertilizer for the next crop. It is Thanh's dream to be able to finance the education of all her children. She hopes all her children will finish college, attain good jobs and be financially independent. In the picture, Thanh is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy wood for rebuilding downgraded house and buy fertilizer for the next crop

loans.name: Moain

texts.en:
Moain is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a,Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living, in order to offer them better alternatives for progress. He has spent five years working in business. He didn`t complete his studies, due to the bad situations he faced, and nobody tried to help him to continue his studying. 

Moain describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. So, he is asking for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer more variety to his customers, in order to always cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family. He hopes to expand his business so that it can continue to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products so as to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
This is Jefferson, 24, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is still single and he lives with his parents. He helps them in managing their household as he also works to help his family.

Jefferson maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle unit (a motorcycle with a sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. They have four tricycle units. The other three tricycles are being used by other tricycle drivers who then remit their daily quota.  He earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP from his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Jefferson dreams to have more tricycle units and hopes that his family will always be in a good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Pa Bong 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoi is a Kho-mu ethnic minority and the age of 24. She is living in a thatched cottage with her husband and their two children. One kid is in kindergarten and the other is in primary school. 

Phoi and her husband are working as farmers with many agriculture activities including cultivating rice, cereal, coffee, and breeding pigs and buffalo. Now she not only faces the difficulty of a lack of capital but also pig diseases. She wants to use the loan of 4,000,000 VND to buy more pigs, food and vaccines for pigs. Phoi dreams of her children completing their studies at school and for her to be successful in her business. 

Phoi is the team leader of Pa Bong 3 group, which consist of 12 Kho-mu ethnic members. In the picture, she is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, food and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Ta Let Group

texts.en:
Ms. Dan is a single Thai lady and is 28 years old. She has been working on the farm since she was 12. Ever since her parents passed away when she was 16, she had to take care of herself and her younger brother. She said that at first she faced a lot of difficulties due to a lack of education (she quit school after 5th grade) and lack of capital because her family was poor, yet she made it through life. With support from ACE for agricultural training, Dan gained more experience on raising cattle and farming. For this loan cycle, Dan wants to use her loan to buy more piglets to expand her farm. 

She hopes that she can have a sustainable income to let her younger brother, who is currently in the 11th grade, go to university. She's proudly said that he's a smart one and deserves to have a good life. Dan is the team leader of Sai Luong Group, which consists of 13 Thai ethnic members. In the photo, she wore a red sweater, first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Hayman

texts.en:
Hayman is a 21-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He is an employee getting a low salary.

Hayman is about to get married. He intends to buy construction supplies for his house, but he does not have enough money to buy what he needs. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy construction supplies to complete building his house. He hopes to establish a retail shop in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building his house

loans.name: Kausar's Group

texts.en:
Kausar is age 33, living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her living standard is not up to the mark because her husband has not adopted a profitable business yet. Her husband owns a bird shop; he sells parrots, various sparrows, and pigeons. He has sold most of the birds and spends his profit amount on household expenses. Nowadays, he does not have sufficient birds in stock for selling. However, due to the lack of funds he is unable to buy more birds to sell.

Therefore, Kausar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy more birds to sell. He will buy more parrots, pigeons, rabbits, sparrows etc. Kausar is very thankful to Kiva and Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more animals for birds shop.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 29 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife and one child who attends the primary school.

In the first of May 2009, Shadi opened his own barbershop. He recently hired an employee to help him because his costumers are continuously increasing as he is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair, shaving machine, and to redecorate his shop. This will increase the number of clients and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair, a shaving machine, and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Romoz

texts.en:
Romoz is 21 years old and she lives with her family in Gaza. She dreams to be a businesswoman and insure good living conditions for her future kids and to avoid asking for help from anyone. Romoz works in her office as a tutor to the students.

Romoz is working hard to improve her business.  She has one employee. She applied to Ryada for this youth loan because she needs to buy tools like blackboards, chalk, tables and chairs to expand her office.

Romoz is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy tools like blackboards, chalk, tables and chairs to expand her office

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is from the peaceful village of San Marcelo. She is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She owns and operates a general store within her village. She has been in this business for more than one year and usually earns about PHP 300 to PHP 400 a day. She is determined to have a better way of life, educate her only child, and stock her grocery items. She decided to seek additional capital amounting to PHP 7,000. She will use this amount to buy grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, condiments, and junk food to sell. She believes that through her loan, she will improve her business and provide her family a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, condiments, and junk food to sell

loans.name: Abdul Rasheed

texts.en:
