Abdul Rasheed is a man of 50 years. He has been running a school bag sale shop in the market. His family consists of seven persons including five children. His children are all in student life right now, so he is the single earner and fulfills all types of requirements of the whole family.

During last year he contacted BRAC Pakistan staff for getting a loan so that he can invest in his shop and get more income. In this way he would be able to maintain his life standard and his whole dependent family's requirements. So he took loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more school bags for resale.

In his loan repayment behavior he proved himself  regular, honest and punctual.

Now he again received a loan from BRAC for the betterment in his business. Abdul Rasheed is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more school bags for resale.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is a 52-year-old farmer who is a hard working man. He has been doing his best in order to have good living conditions someday. With his determination to earn a better income, he doubles his hard work in cultivating his farm land to gain better crops.

Charlie has managed his farming business for 17 years. He knows that this kind of business is not an easy occupation, but despite his situation, his desire to achieve his dream inspires him to develop his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to develop the growth of his crops. He hopes that through these farm inputs he can grow plenty of crops for the betterment of their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use for farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and other retail products.

loans.name: Shawq

texts.en:
Shawq is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in Gaza.

She has a poultry farm and she earns a monthly income of 350 USD. She started her business in 2010. This business helped the family income, especially as they have kids and need to ensure their needs, because her husband works in a public institution and is familiar with low salaries. 

She needs this youth loan to repair the poultry yard and buy food for the birds. Her dream is to educate her children and give them the best in their life. Shawq is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair the poultry yard and buy food for the birds

loans.name: Nhela Jean

texts.en:
Nhela Jean joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle used for public transportation.

Nhela Jean dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina lives at San Roque. She is 60 years old, married and has eight children. Her children live separately from her. 

Adelina's source of income comes from buying and reselling scrap materials such as bottles, cans and plastics. She hopes to keep improving her sales but has insufficient funds, and that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.

The requested loan will be invested in buying more used bottles, empty cans and old newspapers to resell for profits. 

She hopes to keep generating good sales to earn more profits to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more used bottles, empty cans and old newspapers to resell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 45-years-old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines.  She earns a living through a furniture making business.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative.  Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy wood for her furniture making business to answer the demands of her costumers.

Myrna deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Zia-Ul-Qamar

texts.en:
Zia-Ul-Qamar’s age is 49. She is married and living with five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her two sons are doing small jobs but their earnings are very poor. She owns a small business selling clothing at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them at higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. Now the winter season is going on, she wants to buy the clothes of the winter season to sell. But she does not have capital to do this due to household expenses.  She requested a loan so she can buy clothes of the winter season to fulfill the demand. 

She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better facilities to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell at home.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of sewing clothing at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for ladies in the neighborhood or her hometown. She earns enough to lead a decent life.
 
To help her continue operating her business, Asma requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuous work. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with household expenses.

Asma thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes at home.

loans.name: Verónica Andrea

texts.es:
Verónica, a sus 25 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente como estilista de belleza, conoció el oficio porque realizó cursos de capacitación y la experiencia laboral la obtuvo trabajando en una sala de belleza; pero luego de un tiempo tomó la decisión de independizarse y comenzó prestando sus servicios a domicilio y en algunas ocasiones sus clientes van a la casa donde reside; trabaja todos los días y ofrece los servicios de corte, cepillado, químicos, manicure, pedicure, peinados, entre otros; así ha logrado generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos, porque cuando inició como independiente, no poseía los implementos de trabajo y debía esperar a que se los prestaran para realizar los domicilios; sin embargo, con empuje y mucho esfuerzo logró adquirirlos.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, con el dinero comprará insumos al por mayor (químicos, accesorios de decoración de uñas y peinados, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros) y activos (cepillos y plancha de cerámica); esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y además podrá agilizar en tiempo con sus propias herramientas de trabajo; así mejorará las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Verónica sueña con tener su propia sala de belleza ubicada en un local comercial abierto al público, para mejorar su rentabilidad y garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Veronica is 25 years old and works on her own as a beauty stylist.  She learned this work because she took a training course and she got her work experience working in a beauty shop but after some time she decided to go out on her own and began offering her services in people’s homes and at times her customers go to her home.  She works every day and does cuts, combings, chemical treatments, manicures, pedicures, hairstyles, and other things.  She has managed to generate the resources she needs to help her husband with the household finances.

She has overcome several obstacles because when she started her business, she didn’t have any work tools and she had to wait to borrow them to work.  However she was able to acquire them through her drive and lots of effort.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies in quantity (chemicals, nail and hair decorations, shampoo, conditioner, and other things) and assets (brushes and a ceramic iron).  This will allow her to have these items available to satisfy her customers’ needs and speed things up by having her own tools.  She will be able to increase her sales and income.

Veronica dreams of having her own salon located in a shopping center so she can increase her profits and guarantee stable finances, a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Roselieta

texts.en:
Roselieta is 44 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She earns a living through driving a motorcycle.

She has been a member of PMPC since 2008 and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy motorcycle spare parts for maintenance.

Roselieta deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons and two daughters in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education so he became a fisherman. He has been a fisherman since 2006. He earns monthly around $500. In 2012, he opened a shop for selling fish.

In order to increase his business capital and to expand his selling capacity, Yaseen asked Ryada for this loan. He plans to buy a refrigerator for the fish, which will lead to an increase in his stock and his income.
 
Yaseen hopes that this loan will lead to support the needs of his family and allow him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for the fish, which will expand his selling capacity to more customers.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 38-years-old.  He lives with his wife and his two children in the Gaza strip, one of his children attends the public primary school. 

Ashraf is asking Ryada for this loan to buy paints and doors.  This will help him to take step forward because he has a shortage of money to install doors and paint his house.  Improving the house and making it better will enable them  to live with more physical comforts. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy paints and doors for his house.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in Qaffin village at Tulkarm-Qaffin, a Palestinian town located 22 kilometers northeast of Tulkarm in the Tulkarm Governorate in the northwestern West Bank. The town is an agricultural town.

Mahdi is asking Ryada for this loan to repair the closet in the kitchen and paint the house. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house and make it better. This will enable them to live with more psychological comfort. He has a shortage of money. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the closet in the kitchen and paint the house.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a restaurant located in a busy area and has been in the business since 2009. He invested in this business so as to fight poverty from his family. He faces a problem of the fluctuation of food prices. He hopes to own a big hotel in his town and move to his own house.

Alex has asked for a loan to complete his residential house.

loans.use: to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, 53, is the mother of four children. Her husband does work in a small firm on very low daily wages. This is the reason she is doing a small job at home along with her daughters.

Samina is taking a loan to buy stocks of sequins, pearls and gum for pasting over dresses to sell to the retailers. She has been pasting sequins over dresses and shawls for many years and feeding her children.
 
She has to arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughters and dowries as well. Samina is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will enable her to increase the monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy pearls, sequins, and gum for pasting over dresses and shawls to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, vegetables and carrots

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. He is a farmer and also does motorcycle transportation to supplement his income. Since he operates in a rural area, he is challenged by weather changes and the poor roads that make transportation of his products difficult. He wishes to educate his children to university level. Ivan is acquiring a loan to prepare his gardens ahead of the planting season.

loans.use: to prepare his gardens ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is 52-years-old, married and a resident of Diwaan, Dapitan City, Philippines.  She is gifted with five children.  Starting with capital of PHP 10,000, she opened a sari-sari store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative.  Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op.  Now she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future she wants to own a mini-mart someday and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 53, is married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She has four children.

From her desire to help the family, Elsa engaged in dried fish-vending, starting with capital of PHP 2,000. Her business has operated for 30 years already. 

Now, Elsa is planning to borrow  PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, of which she became a member, two years ago. She wants to have a stall in the public market, to display her dried fish. Someday, Elsa will be happy, seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He deals in motorcycle transport and has a restaurant as an alternative source of income. He has been in the transport business since 2003, a business he started with an aim of being self-employed and meeting the increasing demands of his family. He is faced with a challenge of poor roads but intends to buy a car for transport in the future.

Azizi is requesting a loan to buy a third motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a third motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Cecilia una de las fundadoras del grupo “Cristo Salvador” conformada por 07 socios responsables y solidarios que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han ido mejorando. Cecilia de 55 años es  casada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella  se dedica al pelado de ajíes para luego ser distribuidos en mercados y tiendas, lleva en esta actividad más de 08 años. Cecilia se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su pareja con los gastos. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de ajíes. El deseo de Cecilia es de independizarse, pues actualmente trabaja con un familiar. El grupo “Cristo Salvador” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Cecilia se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo blanco y chaleco negro.
texts.en: Cecilia is one of the founders of the “Cristo Salvador” group, made up of seven responsible and united women who have been improving through their efforts.  Cecilia is 55 years old, married and has two adult children.  She peels peppers for later selling in stores and markets.  She has been doing this for more than 8 years and she is happy because she can continue helping her husband with the household expenses.  She is asking for this loan to buy peppers.  Cecilia works with her family.  The “Cristo Salvador” group is grateful to those who made this loan possible.  Cecilia is standing on the right, wearing a white polo shirt and black vest.

loans.use: to buy peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 42-year-old married man with 9 children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in motorcycle transportation and also deals in asbestos for extra income. He got engaged in this business to have several sources of income. However, he is challenged by limited capital and labor to work on the asbestos. Julius is requesting a loan to rent land for asbestos dumping.

loans.use: to rent land for asbestos dumping.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” se siente muy satisfechos por estar pasando el 03 ciclo. Cristina tiene 32 años es casada con 03 hijos  dependientes. Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de flores en el cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus 03 hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cristina es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo fucsia.
texts.en: The members of the “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” group are very satisfied to be in their 3rd cycle. Cristina is 32 years old. She is married and has three dependent children. She grows and sells flowers and has the help of her three children. She will invest the loan in buying seeds and fertilizer to improve her crops. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Cristina is third from the right and wearing a fuchsia t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leticia Verónica

texts.es:
Leticia es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzados. 

Leticia es casada, tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño tiene un año de edad. Su esposo es transportista, ambos velan por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos.  Leticia solicita el crédito para continuar invirtiendo a su negocio, comprará ropa para niños, cosméticos, perfumes y calzados, y así aumentar la demanda de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leticia is a small merchant who has been selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes for several years.

Leticia is married, has three children and the youngest is a year old.  Her husband is a driver and both work for their children’s wellbeing and to provide them with an education.  Leticia is asking for a loan to continue her business.  She will buy children’s clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and shoes so she can increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is married and a business-minded woman who operates a grocery store from her home to supplement her husband’s income. She sells a variety of grocery products to neighbors, her relatives and friends, earning a decent income for the family’s daily needs. She is now 24 years old and lives with her spouse and two young children in Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province.

In order to increase the volume of sales and satisfy her customers’ needs, Phally has requested a loan of USD 1,000 to restock her store with basic commodities and also make home renovations. Phally has never been with other local state banks before because of the high collateral requirement, so she has turned to HKL, a reliable institution, for these funds.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and also make home renovations.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 34 años de edad, no estudio por motivos de escasos recursos económicos, ella es acompañada su esposo trabaja en la construcción de casas, ya que él es albañil. Es madre de 3 hijos viven con ella en su casa, 2 estudian y uno todavía no porque no tiene la edad.

Ella se dedica a lo que es el cuido de cerdos, ya que a este trabajo es lo que ella se dedica y también a lo que es el oficio de su casa,  ella decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que el oficio de su hogar es  muy poco y en espacios que ella tiene libre se dedica a darles el cuido a ellos. También en estas actividades se involucran sus hijos, después que llegan de la escuela.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar una cerda reproductora y alimentación para los lechones que esta tenga, ella le comprara concentrado para darle una buena alimentación  y que sus cerditos tengan un buen desarrollo.

Ella a futuro planea tener unas 2 cerdas reproductoras, que le permitan estar generando sus ingresos a la hora de vender los lechones y así obteniendo una mejor rentabilidad y disminuir sus gastos de producción.
texts.en:
Santos is a 34-year-old woman, she did not study because there were scarce economic resources. She is accompanied by her husband who works in house construction, since he is a mason. She is the mother of 3 children who live with her in her house. Two study and one still doesn't because he is not of age.

She makes a living caring for pigs, since this is the job that she does and also this is the trade of her home. She decided to dedicate herself to this work since the trade of her home is very small. In the free time that she has, she dedicates herself to caring for the pigs. She also includes her children in these activities, whom she takes to school afterwards.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy a breeding sow and feed for the piglets that she has. She will buy concentrated feed to give them a good feeding and so that her piglets develop well.

In the future, she plans to have 2 reproductive sows, which will allow her to generate income at the time of selling her piglets and, therefore, obtain more profitability and decrease her production costs.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow and feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is 31 years old and lives in Villaramos, Manukan Zamboanga del Norte. She is blessed with four children.

Fedelina's business helps her, especially in their daily needs and sending her children to school. 

Fedelina requested an amount of PHP 8,000 for additional capital to pay for additional stocks of dry goods items. She hopes and prays that her business will be successful and she is very thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor would she be properly guided in her finances.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of dry goods items to sell.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en: Wenifreda lives in Sulangon, Dapitan City, Philippines. She is married and has one child. She joined PMPC in 2007. After hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. Recently, Wenifreda asked for a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for additional fish to sell. She makes use of teared foam in her fish vending and also hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes she will raise more income which will help for expansion of her business. Wenifreda has found comfort in PMPC. She is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is from  Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. She is  64 years old and is married  with four kids. Farming is her source of income. Cultivating rice, vegetables, plants, and fruits in their garden, she invests her time.

In 2007, Irenea applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligation in a timely manner.

Recently, Irenea is asking for a financial assistance of PHP 6,000 to  buy fertilizers, pesticides, and other farming supplies to sustain the growing plants and crops. Through this, she hopes to increase her more income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farming supplies

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo desde hace mucho tiempo. Sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven aparte y cuando pueden le colaboran con la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de lácteos(queso, crema y Leche.) y helados desde hace 4 años. EL negocio lo tiene en su hogar de residencia y es así como logra sacar los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su esposo trabajan duramente para ganarse el pan de cada día. Desea mejorar el piso de su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y desea pavimentar el corredor para tener mayor higiene. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para dar inicio a la mejora del piso.
texts.en: María is 45 years old. She has lived in her own home with her husband for a long time. Her children are adults and live on their own. When they can they contribute to the household budget. María has sold dairy products (cheese, cream and milk) and ice cream for 4 years. She has the business in her home and that is how she is able to get income to support the household. With her husband, she works hard to earn the daily bread. She wants to improve the floor in the house because it is a dirt floor now. She wants to pave the hallway to have more cleanliness. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel to begin improving the floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “LOS GERANIOS” se encuentran pasando el 03 ciclo. Cynthia tiene 26 es soltera con hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos colonias y a la venta de zapatos carteras a pedidos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos y carteras por campaña para expenderlos un precio  que le genere mejores ingresos económicos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cynthia es la primera del lado derecho. De la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Crecencia que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en: The “LOS GERANIOS” are in their third cycle.  Cynthia is 26 years old, single, and has one son who depends on her.  She sells beauty products, colognes, and shoes to order. She will use the money from this loan to buy shoes and wallets to sell and generate income.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Cynthia is the first to the right.  Crecencia’s photo is attached because she was not able to attend the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy shoes and wallets.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 42-year-old married mother of eight, lives in Villaramos, Manukan Zamboanga del Norte. Despite hardships in raising her family, this industrious woman finds herself plowing her rice field and planting vegetables and other crops.

In need of additional capital, Jocelyn joined Paglaum Cooperative and has thus far received several loans; she is now requesting a new one for PHP 25,000.00 to pay for fertilizers and labor costs involved in cultivating the land. 

Being an MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, Jocelyn has been able to manage her income, providing for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful, for were it not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

Jocelyn hopes to own more rice fields someday to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To pay for additional fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2008 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy stocks for her small store.

Flor dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for sari-sari store business

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Alia was born in 1961. She is living in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her six sons and daughters and her husband. Her husband owns several kiosks at the Dead Sea which is considered as a tourist place where he sells hot drinks and snacks to tourists and people living there. 

After Alia noticed the financial crisis her family are facing, she decided to start running a mini-market at her house where she has been selling food products for one month. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of food products to improve their living conditions and to provide her children with the best education. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica al servicio de coche turístico, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante en la vida. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha podido darle mantenimiento a su coche para mejorar la atracción y el servicio a su clientela. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pintura, con el fin de darle un acabado a sus cuatros coches. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar su clientela ya que tendrá una mejor presentación e incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en: Carlos is from the city of Granada. He works in a tourism car service. This has allowed him to get ahead in life. He is grateful to the Kiva and MiCredito because he has been able to do maintenance on his car to improve the attraction and service for customers. He is asking for a new loan to buy paint in order to out a finish on his four cars. He thinks the loan will help him to increase his customers since he will have better appearance and will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Na Sang 2 Group

texts.en:
Tam is a single mom of Lao minority. She divorced from her husband 3 years ago and brought up her child on her own since the child was 2 years old. To earn a living, Tam works hard with plenty of agricultural activities such as cultivating rice, vegetables and cereal, breeding chickens, pigs and buffalo. 

This is her first loan in Anh Chi Em Program and Tam hopes this loan can help her resolve partially the difficulty of lacking capital. She would use the loan to rent a machine for leveling the field in order to prepare for the next harvest. 

Tam dreams her child will eventually attend college as she was only able to complete secondary school because financial issues made it impossible for her to continue. In the picture, Tam is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to rent a machine to level the field preparing for the next harvest

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is  72 years old, married, and a resident of  Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. She has earned a living through having a sari-sari store for 10 years and investing it.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase stocks for her business.

Jovita deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her sari-sari store business

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Nedelina

texts.en:
Nedelina is 53 years old and married. She lives in Villaramos, Manukan Zamaboanga del Norte, Philippines. To earn a living, she raises pigs. 

Through PMPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feed and piglets. She hopes that her business will expand and benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Honey Meashell

texts.en:
Honey Meashell is 25 years old,  married, and a resident of Manga,Tangub City, Philippines. Her husband is a government employee. They have two children, who are in the infant age.  Starting with a capitalization of 5,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last August 2013 and has taken out two loans. 

Now she is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Bebelinda

texts.en:
Bebelinda is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Villaramos, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a responsible wife and helps her husband in cultivating land for rice production.

In need of additional working capital, Bebelinda joined PMPC and is requesting a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides. PMPC provided guidance for Bebelinda in her finances and savings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en:
Mamoun was born in 1984. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his two sons and wife. Mamoun is working at the military which is a weak source of income that can help him cover his family needs. 

He started his project of raising birds and selling them one year ago. Now he needs to expand his project by buying a larger quantity of birds in order to raise his profit and income. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more birds for his business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 32 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a female and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children.

She sells maize and beans and started the business in 2010 so as to generate income. She has hopes of having a good and healthy family. However she is challenged with competition and price fluctuations. She is a hardworking lady and wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 33-year-old married woman and she has two children. They attend primary school.

In 2011 she thought to do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members.

And from 2011 until now she has been sewing women’s clothes. Her goods are customized for her clients.

Her dream is to open a business with large number of employees working in her business to give them the opportunity to work and get income. Abeer asks Ryada for this loan to buy a sewing machine and electronic generator. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and electronic generator

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is a 41-year-old married woman and an industrious farmer from Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. For more than twenty years now, she has managed an agricultural business growing rice on her own farm, which she inherited from her parents. Phally works hard to secure enough food for the family. She has four children, but currently only two of them still depend on her.

Phally is asking for a loan of USD 600 to build a hygienic latrine for her family. This way she can improve her sanitation practice for the sake of her children. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phally is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her family.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Las Aguilas  está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cinco de las dieciocho señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Rogelia es vendedora de ropas, es una persona muy sacrificada, que con mucho esfuerzo pudo empezar a trabajar, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas y seguir ayudando a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar ropas variadas, para que por medio de eso pueda seguir con sus ventas y luchando por mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Las Águilas, [The Eagles] are in their first cycle of the communal bank program, in which they have all committed themselves to working and helping each other to move forward.  They are completing the elimination of poverty survey, where five of the eighteen ladies find themselves below the poverty line, with low income, but they are fighting to improve their lives. 

Rogelia, who sells clothing, is a very selfless person.  With great effort she was able to begin working, and through her work she helps her family.  Her dream is to be able to have a shop where she could sell her clothing and continue helping her family.
 
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in purchasing an assortment of clothing.  In this way, she can continue with her sales and continue striving to move out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser acogedora, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, su bodega se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable, Lucrecia es una mujer que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Lucrecia is 51 years old.  She lives in the Oyotun district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru’s north coast.  The community is known for its hospitality and its people are engaged in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.  Lucrecia is engaged in selling basic necessities.  Her grocery store is located in her home, and she has a considerable number of customers.  She is a woman who makes an effort in her work.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise to stock her business and, in this way, generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asma is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her four siblings and her parents. One of her brothers is in the military. Asma is studying for her Bachelor's degree majoring in law. She is in her second year. She is one step closer to graduation and is planning to work in her field to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis. 

Asma is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for her upcoming semester fees as her family is not able to help her.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mays

texts.en:
Mays is a 20-year-old lady who lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her five siblings and her parents. Her mother is a private teacher. 

Mays is studying for a bachelor's degree,  majoring in banking and finance, and she is in her second year. She is one step closer to graduation and is planning to work in her study field after that to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her university registration fees for the semester.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 52 years old and lives with his family in Prey Veng province. As other local people, Ry works in agriculture, growing rice both for sustenance and sale. He has learned to do this from his parents and older people and has been in this career for more than 30 years. His wife and children are the main force/labor in helping him with the farming works.

He is requesting a loan of 700 US dollars to build a safe latrine as he doesn’t have it yet at home. In this way, he can improve sanitation and general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Ry to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment. He expresses his thanks to all kind lenders around the world.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hija y su nieta de 12 años de edad. María es una mujer trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado comprar tres vacas las cuales son su principal fuente de ingresos ya que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para extraer la leche que luego convierte en delicioso queso, crema y requeson. Así es como ha logrado mantener la economía del hogar y llevar el sustento a su familia. Actualmente no cuneta con agua potable y energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de agua potable y de la energía eléctrica. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida  y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and her granddaughter who is 12 years old.

María is a hardworking woman who through a lot of effort has managed to buy 3 cows which are her main source of income. Every day she gets up very early to milk the cows and later she makes it into a delicious cheese, cottage cheese, and makes other products from cream. This is how she has managed to maintain the household expenses and provide for the family.

Currently she does not have drinking water or electricity so she has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the installation of drinking water and electricity. She hopes to receive this loan so she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of drinking water and electricity in her home

loans.name: Na Sang 1 Group

texts.en:
Ly is a 34-year-old woman of Lao minority. She is living with her father, younger brother, who is 20 years old, and her child, who is 6 years old. When her child was born, she divorced her husband because he was using opium drug. Despite financial difficulties, she sends her child to school. 

Ly and her father and her brother are working as farmers. They're planting rice, cereal, vegetables and coffee, and raising pigs and some other cattle. This is the 4th cycle of loans and she will use the money to rent a machine to level the field they are preparing for the next crop. She says that it's hard to obtain capital to do her business so she's thankful to ACE and Kiva's lenders who help her deal with this problem. 

She hopes that her child will complete junior high school and be successful in the future so that her family's life will be improved. In the picture, Ly is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to rent a machine to level the field.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet is 52 and an experienced farmer from a remote area of Kampong Cham province. She is married with six children, two of whom are employed in the garment sector in Phnom Penh. To meet the needs of her family, Chet has been engaged in the rice-farming business for many years and earns a decent income. Her husband is very supportive and always helps her manage their farm. 

With the purpose of aiming to improve general living conditions, Chet is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to build a safe latrine at home. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Chet to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very grateful to all kind lenders in advance.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Selling vegetable is the primary source of income for Virgilio right now. He is 26 years of age. He is happily married and blessed with two children. He has been running his business for two months. He receives a net income of PHP 400 a day. To this end, he is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase cabbage and squash to sell. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage and squash to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains and perishable goods for her store

loans.name: Sreyon

texts.en:
Sreyon, aged 32, is a resident from Preah Sdach district in Prey Veng province. She is married, but she and her husband live separately due to unavoidable circumstances. She has a daughter who is in school. To cover the daily cost of living, Sreyon relies on the income from her rice-farming business and retailing store. She has been doing this for nearly five years.

As this will be her first loan, Sreyon will initially invest in the purchase of a solar home system in order to gain access to electricity. In this way, she can provide light for her children to study at night and use other home devices such as TV, radio etc. With the loan support, she hopes to improve her general living conditions and make their lives more comfortable. She thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is 39 years old, and lives with her husband and some children in Chrang Khpos village, a rural zone in the Rokhak Kiri disctrict, which is located in Battambang province. Two of her children are employed as paid laborers in Cambodia’s neighboring country, Thailand, where they expect to earn a higher income than what they do locally. They send a small remittance home to their parents each month in order to help their younger brother and sister in their education. However, Nhanh doesn’t rely on her children’s remittance. She, together with her husband, works in agriculture, growing rice on their own land, which was inherited by their both parents. She has about 10 years experience in this field. 

As of now, she is requesting a loan to build a safe latrine at home. In this way she hopes to increase the value of her home, and improve sanitation. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Nhanh to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Vut

texts.en:
Vut, a 36-year-old married man, currently lives with his wife and three dependent children in a remote area of the Siem Reap province. Two of his children are attending the local primary school. Vut’s family relies on the income from a farming and  a recycling business. Together, Vut and his wife, are able to earn approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

With this loan amount, Vut will buy a used motorcycle to meet the transportation needs of the household and enable him in his recycling business. Vut hopes that with more savings and stability in his income, he can improve his family's living standard and provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to meet the transportation needs of the household and enable him in his recycling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan was born in 1959. She is a widowed woman living in a rented house with her son at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Asmahan is trying her best to provide her son with the best education and to cover their needs after her husband's death. Her son is a student who also works at a kitchen store. She has been running her project of sewing clothes at home for 1 year, and now she needs to expand by buying more fabric and sewing tools to be more productive. As she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and sewing tools for her business

loans.name: Las Manitos De Jesús Group

texts.es: Inocencia de 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 1 hijo del cual aún depende de ella. Lleva 1 año como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de productos de variedad ya que cuenta con una Bodega. Comenzó por medio de la necesidad de tener ingresos ya que su esposo había fallecido por eso que puso su propio negocio como una persona independiente. También se dedica la venta de comida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Inocencia ha logrado construir su casa y a darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y servicios su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es que crezca su negocio, terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa y que su hijo estudie en la universidad. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de abarrotes en general. Inocencia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Manitos de Jesús”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
Inocencia is 49 years old, a widow with one child who is dependent on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for one year. She sells a variety of products as she has a store. She started because of the need to have some income as her husband died. So she opened her store as an independent person. She also sells meals.

With her effort and work she has managed to build a house and offer a higher quality of living to her family. She covers the cost of education, food, clothing and services for the household. Her future plan is to expand her business, complete the construction of the second floor of her house and send her son to study at university.

Inocencia will use the loan to buy groceries. She belongs to the “Las Manitos de Jesús” communal bank, which is composed of six members. Inocencia is the president.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Hom is 56 years old and a married woman with four children. She runs a small business farming and selling rice in her region of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She has been doing this for over 30 years and has the support from her husband and children.

As of now, she is seeking a loan which enables her to build a household latrine. In this way, she can improve sanitation and general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Hom to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very thankful to all lenders for their generous funds.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
This is a 51-year-old woman and a resident from a peaceful village of Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. Her name is Thoeun. She's married with three grown-up children, two of whom who are studying at universities. Thoeun and her husband are working as farmers with a lot of agricultural activities, including growing rice, cassavas, and breeding poultry. She has been in this field for almost 30 years.

She is now asking for a loan, which enables her to build a household latrine to improve their general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special interest rate, has helped to encourage Thoeun to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very thankful to all lenders for their generous funds.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve their general living conditions.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Doña Marta es una humilde señora de 51 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Madre soltera de un hijo ya independiente. Es de oficio costurera, se dedica a la confección de ropa. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, el cual aprendió observando a su hermana realizando vestidos; luego, poco a poco, fue aprendiendo todo en el ramo de la costura. Actualmente mantiene su negocio de costura muy productivo. Su meta próxima es expandirse en el mercado para dar a conocer su trabajo de costura. Solicita un crédito para comprar telas al por mayor, cipers, botones, accesorios para los vestidos, hijos entre otros, con el fin de realizar mas la elaboración de ropa. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá incrementar la producción de ropa e incrementando los pedidos de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener un taller grande donde pueda ofrecerle más mercadería a su clientela.
texts.en:
Marta is a modest 51 year old woman who is a native of Granada. She is the single mother of a child who is now independent. She is a seamstress who makes clothing. She started this business a number of years ago. She learned by watching her sister making dresses. Then little by little she learned all there is to know to make clothes.

She is quite productive in her business. Her next goal is to expand in the market and make her work well-known. Marta is requesting a loan to buy cloth wholesale, plus zippers, buttons, clothing accessories, thread etc. in order to make clothes. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her production and increase the orders from her customers. Her future plan is to have a large workshop where she can offer more merchandise to her clients.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale, buttons. zippers and accessories for clothing.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan is a thirty-nine-year-old married lady with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a cocoa garden where she gets her side income. She has been in the business since 2010 but is faced with the challenge of limited capital to expand her business. Her dream is to educate all her children at tertiary institutions. Suzan has asked for a loan to add more stock in her business to sell.

loans.use: to add more stock in her business to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old  and married. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a general store in one of the busiest areas. His challenge is inadequate capital to re-invest in his business. 

David is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase vaseline, soap, and salt to sell. He dreams of expanding his business into a big wholesale shop in his town.

loans.use: to purchase vaseline, soap, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona was born in 1972. She is married and lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her husband has a barbershop. For the last four years Mona has been trying her best to support her husband financially and to provide their children with the best education by running her project of selling clothes at her house. She needs to expand it now by buying a larger quantity of clothes and by adding variety to them in order to attract more customers and to increase her profit. As she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad es soltero y habita junto a su madre y dos sobrinos y una hermana quienes dependen económicamente de él. Luis presta servicios de seguridad en una hacienda cercana a su localidad. Con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía familiar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes de la vivienda y encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old. He lives with his mother, two nephews, and a sister who all depend on him economically. Luis works in security at an estate close to his home. With the money he makes at his work, he manages to pay the household expenses and maintain the family economy.

Luis is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of his house and to cement in the floors which presently are packed dirt. He wants to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of his house and cement in the floors.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah is a 20-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa with her 4 siblings and her parents. Farah is studying for a bachelor's degree majoring in English Literature and Educational Studies. She is now in her 2nd year so she is one step closer to graduation. After graduating, she is planning to work in her field of study in order to start helping her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 22-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her two siblings and her parents. Hala is working as a cashier at a restaurant and at the same time studying for her Bachelor’s degree, majoring in General Communications and Advertisement. She is in her 4th year and is one step closer to graduation. She is planning to work in her study field after that to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is 28 years old; he lives in Gaza with his family. He sells home products in his shop. This job is the only financial income for his family. He earns around $600 monthly. Mubarak asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy shelves, and an electronic generator, and to redecorate his business. He hopes that this loan will help support the needs of his family and allow him to reinvest in his business.

Mubarak is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves, and an electronic generator, and to redecorate his business.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with three sons and one daughter. Nour works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income is barely enough cover the family needs. He would like to work extra hours to improve the family living conditions.

Nour took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to work with. By taking out this loan, Nour can increase his income and also improve the family living conditions.

Nour appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to work with

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a professional teacher. She is 43 years of age and currently living in Brgy. Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. Edna is married with one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in college. 

Edna has a salary of Php 20,000 a month.She requested a loan in the amount of Php. 25,000 to pay the school fees for her son, his tuition fee.

Edna has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2008. She has a big dream for her son, and that is to finish a Bachelor's degree as well as to have a white-collar job.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Khloud

texts.en: Khloud was born in 1989. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her husband who is currently in the military and their two daughters. For five months, Kholoud has been trying her best to support her husband in covering their daughters’ needs by selling blankets. Now she needs to raise her profit by purchasing a larger quantity of blankets, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To purchase more blankets for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with two sons and one daughter. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family needs. He would like to work extra hours to improve the family living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work. By taking this loan, Mohammad can increase his income and also improve the family living conditions.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
Heab is a 38-year-old married woman living in a small village of Kampong Thom province. She and her husband, who are in the same business of growing seasonal crops, are responsible for raising their four children. She owns and manages almost two hectares of farmland for growing rice, beans and cassavas. She earns a decent income of approximately 36,000 KHR per day.

Heab wants to continue developing her farming business and collect better yields at every harvest, but she has inadequate capital. She is therefore requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR so she can buy a piece of land to expand her farming area. With the loan help, she hopes to have an abundant harvest and thus increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to expand her farming area.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a conservative lady, so she asked her brother to take her place in the picture. Sabreen was born in 1981. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her parents and three siblings. She decided to start running her project of selling blankets and home products two months after she noticed the financial crisis her family are facing. 

Now she needs to raise the quantity of her products in order to raise her income and sales, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and home products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah was born in 1966. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her five sons and daughters and her retired husband. Sabah has been assisting her husband financially by running her project of selling clothes for one year. She started out with a small quantity of clothes. Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of clothes in order to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Yolanda Celinda

texts.es:
Yolanda Celinda tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el Distrito de Santo Tomas, una comunidad acogedora, que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes y relieve accidentado que le ha permitido tener diversos pisos ecológicos para desarrollarse mediante la agricultura,, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería.

Ella brinda servicio de molienda de todo tipo de granos maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, todo tipo de menestras, café entre otros, sus clientes son en gran parte comerciantes del Distrito de Santo Tomas y sus Caseríos que se dedican a vender estos granos en sus puestos de venta, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 6 años, cuenta con un basta experiencia en el rubro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un motor para su equipo de molino con lo que tendrá mayor potencia y mayor capacidad para brindar el servicio de molienda y así poder atender a más clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda Celinda is 44 years old.  She lives with her children in the Santo Tomas district, a welcoming community known for its green forests and rugged terrain that have provided the area with diverse ecological zones for agricultural development.  The people are also engaged in business and cattle raising.

Yolanda provides milling services for all types of grains, including white corn, yellow corn, all types of legumes, coffee, and others.  The majority of her customers are business owners from the Santo Tomas district and its villages that sell these grains in their stalls.  She has been engaged in this activity for over six years, and has extensive experience in the trade.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a motor for her mill equipment, with which she will have more power and, in this way, be able to serve more customers, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motor to upgrade her mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 28-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three children ages two, four and seven. Imelda and her husband have had a vulcanizing business for two years now. Their business earns them 15,000 PHP per month that helps support their children's needs. Imelda is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to buy a compressor, vulcanizing rubber and kerosene to help in their daily operation. This will help assure them that their business will be more productive with the availability of the needed materials.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, vulcanizing rubber and kerosene

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a 22-year-old woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She is married and has a 1-year-old child. Her husband works as a construction worker to support their family. She raises and sells hogs to help augment the income of their household. Her hog raising business started almost a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy two more piglets and feed. This will help Eden grow and sell more pigs.

In the future, Eden would like to expand her hog raising business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Hiba is a 29-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and three kids, one son and two daughters, in a small simple house. Hiba's husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family needs. He would like to work extra hours to improve the family living conditions.

Hiba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy a new rickshaw for work. By taking this loan, Hiba's husband can increase his income and also improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw for work

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer was born in 1974. He is married and a father of three. He and his family live in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Samer has been running his restaurant for the past year. He started his business by selling snacks. Now he needs to add a greater variety of snacks in order to attract more customers. He decided to buy a new machine to make an Arab snack called falafel to raise his sales and profit. He doesn’t have enough money to purchase the machine, so he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for making falafel

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. 

Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this, he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. 

Therefore, Khursheed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en: Elya is 20 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his three siblings and his parents. His father is retired. Elya is studying for his Bachelor’s, majoring in Dental Science. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially, as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Saja

texts.en: Saja is a 19-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her four sisters and her parents. She is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Media. She is in her first year. Saja is planning to work in her study field after she graduates to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle El Triunfo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia   de 50  años de edad casada  y madre de  5 hijos, la Sra. Lucia  tiene una pequeña bodega  ya hace unos  7  años. La Sra. Lucia,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos (arroz, menestras, etc.) Para su bodega  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Lucia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Lucia  se le distingue por su camisa de color rojo,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of 5 children.  Lucia has had a small store for 7 years.  She has loyal customers and this has generated enough income to cover her household expenses.  In the future she would like to own a local grocery store where she can sell her products and make a better living.

With this loan she will buy more products (rice, beans, etc.) for her store, which will enable her to continue to meet the needs of her customers so that she will be able to get by.

Lucia and all of the members of the group are thankful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that they have shown by supporting them. Lucia is the woman in the photo with the red top.  She promises to comply punctually with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for their store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old, and she is a sole proprietor of her own shop, in Kisauni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of two whose husband gives additional support and she has been in this business for the last nine years, doing great.

This marks her fourth time borrowing from Vision Fund Kenya to finance her business, after servicing her loans successfully. She will use the money to purchase additional retail stock: boxes of milk, sacks of sugar and trays of eggs. The anticipated profit will be used to service the loan and educate her children. 

She hopes to see her business grow in future and open a second business for her son who is almost adult.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock: boxes of milk, sacks of sugar and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: “MUJERES EXITOSAS” es un grupo compuesto por socios ansiosos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Cicely tiene 35 años es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella es técnica en farmacia trabaja 11 años en un centro de salud. Atrás se dedicaba a ser estudiante. El préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de cursos de especialización y actualización de su carrera profesional. Su mayor es tener una casa propia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cicely es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
“MUJERES EXITOSAS” is a group comprised of members that are eager to improve the quality of life for their families.  Cicely is 35 years old and lives with her two dependent children. She is a pharmacist and has worked for 11 years in a health center.  Before doing this work she was a student.

This loan will be invested in the payment of specialization and refresher courses for her professional career.  Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they have provided.  Cicely is the second person standing on the right-hand side in the white shirt.

loans.use: to pay for specialized and refresher courses.

loans.name: Santa Lucrecia Group

texts.es:
Don Tomás es un señor de 56 años de edad, solo estudio la secundaria y es soltero. Él es otro de los integrantes del grupo Santa Lucrecia, cuenta que como no tuvo la oportunidad de tener más estudios inició a trabajar desde muy joven y tuvo distintos empleos, pero fue hace 19 años que lo invitaron a ser vocero de “La Crónica” (periódico que informa las noticias en Tierra Blanca) y le platicaron que las ganancias que le dejaba eran buenas así que decidió entrar y desde entonces se dedica a la venta del periódico.
Don Tomás es una persona emprendedora que durante muchos años se ha dedicado a esta actividad, él sale todos los días desde muy temprano a comprar el periódico e inicia a venderlo por las calles, sus ventas son buenas ya que tiene buenos clientes. Él dice que termina más rápido de vender cuando las noticias son buenas. 
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que está en contacto con la gente y que gana su dinero a diario informando a la gente de los acontecimientos que ocurren en su región.
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a invertir en la compra de periódicos para continuar con sus ventas.

Él espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Maribel venta de comida
Roxana venta de cosméticos
Alicia venta de quesos, totopos y tlayudas
Teresa venta de topperware
Julia venta de perfumes 
Leticia venta de ropa, manteles y cortinas
Liliana venta de cosméticos 
Maria Eugenia venta  de refrescos 
Leticia M venta de tacos
Verónica venta de cosméticos 
Verónica F compra de variedad de zapatos
texts.en:
Don Tomás is a 56 year old man who is single and only studied until secondary school. He is one of the members of the Santa Lucrecia Communal Bank. He notes that as he did not have the opportunity to get more education, he started working when he was very young and had a number of different jobs. Nineteen years ago he was invited to be a spokesperson for “La Crónica” (a newspaper that publishess the news in Tierra Blanca) and they told him that the profits were good and so he decided to take the job and since then he has made a living selling the newspaper.

Don Tomás is a very enterprising person who for many years has run this business. He departs very early every day to purchase the newspapers and then starts to sell them on the street. His sales are good because he has good customers. He says that he finishes his sales more quickly when the news is good.

What he most enjoys about his business is that he is in contact with people and that he earns his money every day informing people of the events that are happening in their region.  A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help him to purchase newspapers to continue with his sales.

He hopes that with this investment his business will prosper and that he will improve his quality of life.  The other members of the group are:

Maribel – who sells meals
Roxana – who sells cosmetics
Alicia – who sells cheese, “totopos” and “tlayudas”
Teresa – who sells Tupperware
Julia – who sells perfume
Leticia – who sells clothing, blankets and curtains
Liliana - who sells cosmetics
Maria Eurgenia – who sells soft drinks
Leticia M. – who sells tacos
Verónica - who sells cosmetics.
Verónica F – who sells different kinds of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase newspapers.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en: Mouhammad, 63 years old, is an Iraqi client who is married and has 6 children. Mouhammad and 3 of his children provide the family's income together. Mouhammad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2003 and now has a hired employee. Mouhammad has built up good experience in this field. He has an excellent reputation and is becoming well known in the surrounding area. Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $2,700 in order to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.
