loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, a display window and an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Mehrangiz

texts.en:
Mehrangiz is a young woman from a little village of North Tajikistan. She is 18 years old. Mehragiz lives with her parents. After graduating school, she had no opportunity to enter the University. Now, she is going to organize her own business. 

Mehrangiz wants to organize a business that sells clothes and shoes. She thinks that this variety of business will go successfully because there is a great demand for clothes and shoes in a local market. She studied at a course "To Get Ahead"  from a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 10000 TJS to buy clothes and shoes for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Hotam

texts.en:
Hotam was born in 1994. He is a smart and industrious man. Hotam studied well at school. He had good and excellent marks. 

Now, he is a student of the second course. He tries to learn all subjects well. Hotam is one of the successful students. Hotam is not married and lives with his parents. 

Hotam must pay for tuition. Hotam is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el Caserío de San José, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales, caprinos , porcinos, aves y ganado vacuno, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, es una madre emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de más animales para su comercialización y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Digna, 42, and her children live in San Jose, a rural town in Peru's Cajamarca region. The tropical climate here supports rice farming, a common source of income for local people. Other sources of income include small retail businesses and animal-rearing.

Digna raises and sells pigs, poultry, cattle and other farm animals. She has made her living buying and selling animals for more than 10 years. She is an enterprising woman and has worked hard to make a success of the business. She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000-new soles loan that she will use to buy animals that she will fatten and sell. The investment will increase her income and help her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for animals sales business.

loans.name: Guipiles De Tzani Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina de estado civil casada. De 45 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 8 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la elaboración de Gupliles de la región. Inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para elaborar guipiles bordados. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital grande y propio para poder producir por mayor y ofrecer variedad de estilos en sus ventas.

Las demás integrantes del grupo de dedican al comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Paulina is married, she is 45 years old, and she never had the opportunity to attend school.  She has 8 children and 3 of them are in school.  She makes Gupliles from the local region (traditional embroidered blouses worn by women).  She started this business after she was taught the trade from her mother and now she has 10 years of experience doing this work.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy thread in order to create the embroidered blouses. She dreams of a future in which she has capital so that she can produce bulk items and offer a variety of styles for sale.

The women members of this group all work in commerce and crafts.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cacao en los caseríos de Lamparan, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino y vacuno, es una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victor, 61, lives with his wife and children in Pomahuaca, a rural district in Peru's Cajamarca region. The local economy is built around farming, animal-rearing and small retail businesses.

Victor grows cacao in the small rural town of Lamparan. He also raises and sells cattle and other farm animals. His family is solidly behind him and helps him with the business. Victor is applying for a 1,500-new soles loan that he will use to buy organic fertilizer for his next planting. The investment will help him to increase his production and, in turn, his family's income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting his next cacao crop.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, es una mujer de buenos principios y está felizmente casada. Tiene 3 hijas de 41, 39 y 37 años de edad, las cuales gracias a Dios y al esfuerzo familiar ya son profesionales y han formado sus propios hogares. Vive solamente ella con su esposo. Sin embargo, reciben diariamente la visita de sus nietos, para que los cuiden mientras sus padres trabajan.

Desde pequeña Blanca, aprendió en su hogar que en la vida hay que esforzarse para salir adelante. Hace ya treinta años cuando inició vendiendo golosinas y otros productos menores; pero con el tiempo fueron creciendo sus ganancias, hasta que llegó a establecer una tienda con productos variados.

El préstamo lo utilizará, para comercializar útiles escolares,  pues ya se acerca el inicio de clases y la demanda de estos productos es muy alta. Tener la tienda le da un sentido a su vida, pues se mantiene ocupada, además le causa alegría  estar en constante contacto con sus nietos.

Blanca espera ver a sus nietos crecer y llegar a ser buenos profesionales así como sus padres, también espera mantenerse siempre bien de salud para atender siempre el negocio y mantenerse estable como persona.
texts.en:
Blanca, 64, studied up to sixth grade of primary education. She is a woman with good principles and is happily married. She has three daughters aged 41, 39 and 37, who, thanks to God and the effort of the family, they are professional people and have set up their own households. Blanca only lives with her husband. However, every day they have their grandchildren over so that they can look after them while their parents are working.

From a young age, Blanca learned at home that you have to work in life to get ahead in life. It is already 30 years ago that she started selling sweets and other small items, but over time her profits grew, to the point of setting up a store with a variety of products.

Blanca will use the loan to buy school materials, as the school term is approaching and demand for these products is high. Running the store gives meaning to her life as she is kept occupied, and moreover it makes her happy being constantly in contact with her grandchildren.

Blanca hopes to see her grandchildren grow up and become good professionals like their parents. She also hopes to always have good health to attend to the business and stay stable as a person.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 49-year-old woman; her husband has grown old and stays at home. She is the mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son sews diapers along with his sisters at home to help feed the whole family. He has two sewing machines to sew the diapers; the machines are operated by his sisters. His younger brother deals with the vendors and takes orders from them and sews the diapers to order.

Her son wants to sell sewed diapers directly in the market, so that he can get maximum reward for their efforts. But he does not have capital to buy raw material for making diapers. Nargis requested a loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy raw materials such as absorbent pads, elastic, and non-woven fabric for sewing garments.

Nargis thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as elastic, absorbent pads, and nonwoven fabric for sewing diapers.

loans.name: Musavvara

texts.en: Musavvara is hard-working woman from the North part of Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. Musavvara lives with her family happily in a big house. She has her own business. Musavvara has been busy processing and selling milk products. She began her business feeding sheep, and now she has a sheep as well as a milking cow. She sells milk, kefir, and sour cream in a local market. Musavvara would like to increase her working capital, so she is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy milking cow. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 54-year-old landlord and retail shop proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four whose spouse is a housewife, and he has been in these businesses for the last twelve years - and doing great!

This marks Francis' second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to repair his rental houses and purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and washing and bathing soaps for his shop. 

Francis will use the profit from the loan to pay back what he has borrowed, and to expand his shop. He hopes to own and improve more rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to repair his rental houses and purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and washing and bathing soaps for his shop.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is an 18-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her four siblings and her parents. Anwar is studying for a bachelor's degree, majoring in animal production. She is in her first year. 

She is planning to work in her study field after that to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida was born in 1967. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her nine sons and daughters and her retired husband. Aida has been supporting her husband financially by running her project of selling home products for two years. She started it with a small quantity of home products. 

Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of home products and to add accessories to her sales in order to raise her profit and to open her own store to raise her sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Hajar

texts.en:
Hajar is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Hajar is a 34-year-old married woman from Deir El Balah city in the Gaza Strip, Palestine. She lives with her husband and six kids (four sons and two daughters) in a small and simple house. Hajar's husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs, and he would like to work extra hours to improve the family's living conditions.

Hajar took a loan from FATEN, Kiva's field partner, to help her husband buy a new rickshaw to work on, providing rides and transportation to customers. By taking this loan, Hajar's husband can increase his income and also improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy her husband a rickshaw so he can bring in extra income.

loans.name: Leoncio Amado

texts.es:
Leoncio Amado tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando frutas, arroz, cafe, entre otros, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto, tiene una experiencia de 18 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para utilizarlo en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Leoncio Amado, 67, lives with his wife and kids in the district of Pucará, located in Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of the Peruvian northern sierra.  This community is characterized by a hot climate.  Its people work in agriculture, growing fruit, rice, coffee, etc., and also sell agricultural products and raise cattle. 

Leoncio Amado works in agriculture, growing coffee, and has 18 years of experience.  He has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to use for agricultural work, application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizer, and labor for the harvest.  This will allow him to have a good harvest and ultimately a greater output and a higher quality product so he will have no trouble selling his product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other inputs to maintain his coffee fields

loans.name: Wendy Auxiliadora

texts.es: Wendy es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y sin hijos a cargo. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de golosina y gaseosas en su casa. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, vendiendo frijoles cocidos y queso en casa, poco a poco iba creciendo con sus ganancias. Luego, fue comprando golosinas y gaseosas para seguir creciendo con sus ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien próspero y rentable. Su meta próxima es mantener un negocio surtido de productos. Solicita un crédito para comprar gaseosas y golosinas al por mayor, con el fin de incrementar sus productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a obtener mejores ganancias ya que invertirá en el negocio e incrementando sus ventas. Su plan futuro es mantenerse en el negocio.
texts.en: Wendy lives in the Nicaraguan city of Granada.  She is married and has young children.  She operates a retail business, selling soft drinks and snacks, from a space in her house.  She started the business a few years ago, first selling cooked beans and cheese.  She increased her income bit by bit and then switched to soft drinks and snacks in order to increase her income even further.  The business is doing well now, she says, and is profitable.  Her immediate goal is to stock the business with more of the products she sells.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of soft drinks and snacks.  She says the loan will increase her earnings because she will invest the funds in growing her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Aleyda Marilu

texts.es:
Aleyda, desea surtir su inventario con materia prima para elaborar su venta de antojitos, comprara verduras, carnes, aceite, condimentos y pan dulce, para seguir creciendo en su negocio del cual obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
El resultado de la inversión del crédito anterior ha sido muy positivo pues compro los productos necesarios que le facilitaron continuar trabajando, sus ventas aumentaron, tiene más clientes, su economía es más estable.
texts.en:
Aleyda wants to restock her inventory with basic supplies for making street food. She will buy vegetables, meat, oil, condiments, and sweet bread. This will enable her to continue growing her business so that she can generate the necessary income for meeting her financial commitments.

The result of investing her previous loan was very positive. She bought needed products that allowed her to continue working. Her sales increased and she gained more customers. Her financial situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, oil, condiments, and sweet bread.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en: Nazokat is a hardworking woman. She is married and has four children. Three of them are not adults. Nazokat has been busy selling perfumes and cosmetics. She began her business by selling children's clothes. She has been busy with her business for more than 10 years. She has great experience. Her experience helps her to develop the business day by day. She is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy perfumes and cosmetics to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider of the family. 

Alae owns a general store, where he sells basic electrical supplies such as bulbs and other supplies such as duct tape. He has been in this field since 2007 and has been gradually expanding his experience. Alae has an excellent reputation and has earned the respect of his neighborhood. 

Alae is requesting a youth loan of $3,000, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his general store and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with a bright future by educating them and giving them the best of everything.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his general store and to install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a 39-year-old woman from Ubujan District, Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is married with 5 children. The oldest is 13 while the youngest is 6 years old. 

Her husband works as a construction worker to support their family. She engages in raising chickens to help augment the income of their household. She sells whole chickens and their poultry products. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a weighing scale, pail and other supplies needed.  

In the future, Juditha would like to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education as well as for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, pail and other supplies needed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a hardworking youth client from Iraq, is 27 years old, married and has two children. The sole provider for the family, Ali owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. Operating since 2008, he chose this field because he is well versed in it. He now has ample experience and enjoys a good reputation in his local community.

Ali is requesting a 2,400 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his grocery store

loans.name: Solidario En Victoria De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Solidario en victoria de San Lorenzo doña Virginia de 37 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (8, 10, 15, 20 años) la familia se dedica a la elaboración de pan y poseen una panaderia  donde  vende sus productos  (francés, pan dulces, magdalenas, pay,  empanadas, donas etc.) en la aldea de San Lorenzo y como actividad secundaria vende refacciones en su local los sábados y domingos  (hamburguesas, tortillas con queso,  café, jugos, etc.)  Ella solicita su crédito para comprar un congelador  para guardar  sus productos ya que ella  quiere vender licuados y gaseosas frías ya que tiene una gran demanda de sus  clientes y la buscan en su negocio  porque es la única que vende refacciones y comida, su meta es poder tener otro local donde vender sus productos  ya con esto ella puede ayudar a su familia y darles un mejor futuro y darles  una mejor vida de la que ella pudo tener.
texts.en:
Solidario en Victoria de San Lorenzo Group

Virginia, 37, has four children (ages 8, 10, 15, and 20).  The family earns a living making bread.  They have a bakery in the town of San Lorenzo where they sell their products (baguettes, pan dulce, cupcakes, pie, empanadas, doughnuts, etc.).  As a secondary activity, on Saturday and Sunday she also sells snacks there (hamburgers, tortillas with cheese, coffee, juice, etc.).

Virginia's requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator for her products.  She wants to sell shakes and cold soda because there's a lot of customer demand for them in her bakery, which is the only one that sells snacks and food.

Her goal is to be able to have another place to sell her products.  This way she'll be able to help her family and give them a better future and a better life than the one she had.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda was born in 1971. She is a single lady living in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her parents. 

Majeda has been trying her best to support her family financially by running her project of doing hand embroidery for the past 15 years. Her job started as a hobby to her since childhood and became profitable. 

Now she needs to repair her embroidery machine to stay productive and continue her work normally. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to repair her embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Zohara's Group

texts.en:
Zohara is 58 years old and living in Lahore with her son and five children. 

Her son has been running a barber shop for many years. He wants to buy new furniture and instruments but due to financial constraints, he is unable to do so. Due to his low purchasing power, Zohara has requested a loan to empower her son so he can easily buy new instruments such as plastic furniture, a front mirror, shaving gel, and hair cutting equipment.

Zohara hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to save for household expenses. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy plastic furniture, a mirror, shaving gel, and hair cutting equipment.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 53 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con los gastos del hogar. Domingo trabaja como agricultor. Todos los años siembre maíz y yuca en su terreno luego de la cosecha comercializa una parte y el resto lo deja para el consumo. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y pilines.
texts.en: Domingo, 53, and his wife live very modestly.  They share a small house with their three grown children and they all work together to pay household expenses.  Domingo is a farmer.  He has grown maize and yucca on his land for many years.  He sells part of his crop and keeps the rest for his own and his family's use.  He is applying for a FUSAI loan that he will use to repair his roof.  The roof is badly in need of repair and Domingo will use the loan to buy the building supplies he needs for the job.

loans.use: to buy building materials for roof repair.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Julia Felisa, ella tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como azúcar, golosinas aguas gaseosas, granos básicos , así como la venta de refacciones y venta de pasteles, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de abarrotes(productos comestibles) para surtir su tienda, así como juegos pirotécnicos para la venta de época navideña, y el resto para venta de refacciones, su propósito es seguir incrementando los ingresos de su casa ya que su anhelo es seguir mejorando las instalaciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Julia Felisa belongs to the Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo group. She is 37 years old and works selling groceries such as sugar, candy, carbonated water, basic grains, as well as snacks, and pastries. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of groceries (provisions) to supply her store as well as fireworks for the Christmas season, and the rest for ingredients for snacks. Her goal is to continue increasing household income and she is yearning to continue making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadores De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Trabajadores de Magdalena
Este dúo está conformado por don José María, él tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos,  para destazar y preparar  chicharrones, carnitas y venta de carne d cerdo en su domicilio, ubicado en Magdalena Milpas Altas , él está solicitando el crédito para la compra de lechoncitos  así como concentrado de engorde, con el propósito de mantener siempre en crecimiento ya que anhela creser un poco mas en su negocio,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en:
This pair of pig farmers was brought together by Jose Maria, 30 years of age, who raises pigs to use in preparing sausages and pork, which he then sells from his house, located in Magdalena, Milpas Altas.

Jose Maria is requesting a loan to buy suckling pigs plus commercial feed to fatten them. He intends to keep them growing and hopes to increase his business somewhat. Therefore, Jose Maria hopes that you lenders can help fund the loan he is soliciting.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell their meat.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento con los fondos de KIVA doña Nora compro los fertilizantes que necesitaba para poder asistir sus cultivos de café por lo que se encuentra muy feliz, muy satisfecha y muy contenta. Ella dio asistencia y mantenimiento a 4 manzanas de café con 15 quintales de abono con lo cual tuvo un pequeño corte el cual dio beneficios y cancelar su primer financiamiento para nuevamente poder acercarse con la frente en alto para poder solicitar un segundo financiamiento con el cual nuevamente comprara abono para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a otra parte de cultivo que recién planto. Después de su primer financiamiento su vida mejoro ya que en un principio no tenía una forma para poder comprar los insumos que necesitaba y gracias a la confianza que la cooperativa depósito en ella al explicarle sobre los nuevos fondos ella accedió con mucha facilidad por la tasa de interés, el monto y el plazo para poder cancelar su compromiso. Sus metas son poder seguir trabajando en sus cultivos de café hasta donde Dios le permita, ampliar sus cultivos y solidificar sus cultivos para heredarlos a sus hijos.
texts.en: Thanks to a past loan from KIVA lenders, doña Nora bought the fertilizers that she needed to cultivate a coffee crop.  The investment was a success, she says.  She bought organic fertilizers to prepare 4 parcels of land for growing coffee and made a small profit.  She repaid that first loan and feels she can hold her head high now because she met her obligations to her lenders.  She is applying for a second loan that she will use to buy more fertilizer for maintaining another recently-planted field.  The first loan improved her life because she had no other way to secure funds for buying the supplies she needed.  Her community bank believed in her and thanks to their confidence, she was able to borrow the funds she needed at a reasonable rate of interest.  She says that she wants to continue her coffee business for as long as God allows her to.  She hopes that she can grow the business and pass it along to her children one day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee growing business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Joel tiene 42 años, es casado desde hace 17 y tiene dos hijos: un hombre de 16 y su niña de 13. Es taxista, y adicionalmente a esto renta 5 departamentos y 3 locales.

Él tiene 9 años dedicándose a estos negocios y le gusta tener varias fuentes de ingreso para no tener problemas de liquidez, por lo que pide este préstamo para poner un nuevo proyecto que tiene en mente: un puesto de comida. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo Joel ha logrado comprar una casa, construir una propia y gozar de estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joel is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Joel is 42, he's been married for 17 years, and he has two kids, a 16-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl.  He is a taxi driver and he also rents out five apartments and three commercial properties.  He has been in these businesses for nine years, and he likes to have several sources of income to avoid liquidity issues.  He requests this loan to start a new project he has in mind - a food stall.  Through his hard work, Joel has been able to buy a house, build his own house, and enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: to start a business selling food, which he has planned

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 34-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He is a father, with one son and two daughters. 

Mostafa works as an employee in the public sector, with a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs. He also works on his rickshaw by transfering goods in the local market.

Mostafa took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. By taking this loan, Mostafa can increase his income and also improve the family's living conditions. Mostafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido a solicitar más capital para la compra ganado y cerdos, los cuales engordara para luego venderlos, con lo que continuara fortaleciendo su negocio
El crédito anterior le ayudo a comprar el elemento necesario para que la venta de los cerdos fuera más rápida y con mejores ganancias, su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
José has decided to request additional capital for buying cattle and pigs so that he can fatten them for eventual resale.  He hopes to continue strengthening his business.  

His previous loan helped him to buy the items he needed so that he could sell pigs faster and earn more money.  His family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and all her children are grown. She is into multiple businesses such as a sari-sari (variety) store, fishing, and a boat-for-hire service for island hopping and dolphin watching.

Paz supports her grandchildren's needs with her income. She is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy a new fish net for fishing. This will help replace the old one and assure that her and her husband will be more productive. 

She hopes that she can continue her business and find more ways to earn by reinvesting her income and expanding her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish net

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Residing in Dushanbe, Dilorom is a hardworking mother of two small children. Her husband works in a state organization, while Dilorom has been working for more than three years for an organization that pays her a small salary. 

Dilorom's flat, which has three rooms, is in need of repairs, but she lacks sufficient funds. She is therefore requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. to repair her flat

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en: Kafa was born in 1976. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her 12 sons and daughters and her husband who works in agriculture. Kafa has been supporting her husband financially by running her project of selling home products and clothes for two years. She started it with a small quantity of items.  Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of home products and to add children's clothes and cosmetic products to her project in order to increase her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more home products and clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Kebisoni Quick Service Group

texts.en:
Lydia is a 43-year-old woman who is married with five children. She is a member of the Kebisoni Quick Service Group located in Kebisoni and a resident of a rural area, Garubunda parish, Kebisoni sub-county, Rukungiri district. 

She is a hardworking woman with a tailoring business. This enables her to earn some income to look after her children. She started the business with a little savings that she earned from the sale of firewood.  Her tailoring business has grown and from it she has managed to purchase some property including land, cows, and other items. 

She has asked for a loan from the institution, and she expects to earn more profits after investing the same capital in her tailoring business. She is hard working and committed. 

The group thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for the commitment to serve the unbanked.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to tailor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.en:
Bargigul was born in 1965. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are adults, and two of them are non-adults. 

Bargigul has been busy with animal husbandry for more than ten years. She feeds cows. She sells the cattle in a local market, after feeding them for six months. She has great experience and manages her business well. She has additional income from growing pomegranates. 

Bargigul is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy cattle and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. 

She knows very well the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for the nearest factories; her husband brings cloth from the factories. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine because her previous sewing machine is out of order due to continuous work. Also, she wants to purchase a new Juki sewing machine because it will be useful for providing faster and more efficient stitching work. 

In addition to repaying the loan, Yasmeen thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon was born in 1975. She is divorced and has five children. Her children are non-adults. She is the only caretaker of her five children. 

She began own business selling shoes 12 years ago. Little by little, Guljahon developed her business. Some years ago, she changed her business. Now, she sells children clothes. Her business is going well. With her profits, she is able to provide her children with a good education.

She wants to increase her working capital. With this goal in mind, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy children's clothes to resell and increase her working capital. 

She is a repeat client of CSC MDO "IMON International". She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Erika Gabriela

texts.es: Erika de 19 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Erika es muy trabajadora y emprendedora con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado adecuar una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia, además por las tardes vende antojitos típicos los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Erika habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea dar a su hijo condicione más seguras. Desea construir su casa en el terreno heredado por su padre para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y clavos y así dar inicio a la construcción de su casa lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Erika is 19 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her little two-year-old son. 

Erika is very hard working and enterprising, and through great effort she has been able to open a little store in her home.  Also, in the afternoons she sells traditional snacks, which are very much in demand by her customers, with whom she is more popular every day.

Erika lives in very humble conditions, and she wants to provide her son with conditions that are more secure.  She would like to build her home on land that she inherited from her father, for which she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. 

She will invest it in the purchase of necessary materials, such as galvanized sheeting, wood, poles, and nails, so she can begin building her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, poles, and nails to build a home.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SIENSO dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des grains de céréales, légumes et de la restauration.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur 6 eme prêt solidaire. TITA, 1ère femme à de la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   1 tonne de riz non décortiqué. Elle s’approvisionne à sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members are of the Laidou group are all women. On the average, they are 40 years old, with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Sienso, in the district of San/Segou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).

They know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their work. They buy and resell cereals and vegetables and also cook food for sale. Having duly repaid their prior loans, the group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan. Tita, the first one from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy one ton [2204 lbs] of unhusked rice. She stocks up locally and in the nearby villages. She sells to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash and often on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 25,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover the costs related to healthcare, food, clothing and school attendance, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice.

loans.name: Dergham

texts.en:
Dergham is a youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his family of five members. Only three of the family members are employed. 

Dergham is a barber. After previously working for few years as an employee at a barber shop, Dergham established his own business in 2010 and has been gradually gaining more experience in this field. Now, Dergham has an employee and is well-known in his surrounding area.

He is requesting a youth loan of $1200. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop.

In the future, Dergham aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to open a bigger barber shop and attract more customers.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 39-year-old woman. She is married with eight children, aged 18, 16, 15, 13, 12, 10, 9 and 6 years old, whom she supports. 

This is her first loan of KES 20,000. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund officer. She has a grocery, and her business is located at Kwa Chocha. She has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She is planning to use the loan to purchase more stock for her business. She will use the profit to expand the business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 29 years old and the father of two children. He works hard to provide for them. 

Kasem owns a butcher shop. He sells fresh meat, and he also sells sandwiches. He established his business in 2009, having gained his experience by working at another butcher’s shop for several years. He now has hired an employee. Kasem is well known in the market, thanks to his fresh meats and his good sandwiches with affordable prices. 

Kasem is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use it to pay the annual rent for his butchery. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his butchery.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a young and kind 53-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. 

Her son is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling wooden furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over eight years ago. Her son had previously obtained loans for his business; he added up two previous loans to his selection of making furniture. Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand.

Therefore, Zohra came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan for her son so he can buy raw materials such as wooden planks, timber, chipboard and glue for his furniture-making business. Zohra hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as wooden planks, timber, chipboard and glue for furniture-making business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a hardworking married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda and owns a workshop. He is a farmer and also deals in electronics and wiring to earn extra income. 

He used the previous loan to buy radios and spare parts to sell. He went into business to meet the increasing demands of his family. He faces a challenge of competition from similar businesses, but hopes to expand his business into new markets. 

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy electronic wires to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronic wires to sell.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rashida is 53 years old and resides in Punjab, Pakistan with her family. She has four children. She is a simple housewife, and her son is provides white wash services in their locality. 

Rashida is requesting a loan for her son’s business as he needs to buy cans of paint and tools to upgrade his available services. This loan can help her son increase his profits.

After using the field partner's services, she feels good and very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She assures that she will pay back the loan installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase white wash products for her son's shop.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda owns a sari-sari (variety store) in Corella, Bohol. She sells canned goods, cooking oils, snacks, toiletries and detergent. This business started seven years ago. 

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy coffee, cooking oil, chips, candies, shampoo, canned goods and eggs. The loan will improve Rosalinda's inventory and will attract more customers. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy coffee, cooking oil, chips, candies, shampoo, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es: La Sra. Dora Flores tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y es separada de su pareja; sus niños aún están pequeños y dependen de ella. Lleva 1 año como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de desayuno. Comenzó por medio de sus amistades que le impulsaron a este negocio y abrió su propio negocio como persona independiente tiene aproximadamente 150 clientes diarios y va creciendo de manera frecuente. También tiene negocio de comida por las tardes. Con su trabajo Dora ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que ella es el único sustento para sus hijos. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y los pagos de servicios de su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es que su negocio siga creciendo y entre en expansión. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Dora pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Cristo El Salvador”, el cual está conformado por 6 socias y ella lleva el cargo de presidenta
texts.en: Dora Flores is 30 years old.  She has two children and is separated from her partner.  Her children are still young and dependent on her.  She has been an Edaprospo client for one year, and she is engaged in selling breakfast.  She began through friends that guided her to this business and opened her own business independently. She has about 150 customers daily and the number is growing steadily.  She also provides meals in the evenings.  Through her work, Dora has managed to provide her family with a better quality of life since she is the sole provider for her children.  She pays for the costs of meals, education, clothing, and household bills.  In the future, she plans to continue growing and expanding her business.  She will use the loan to purchase merchandise.  Dora belongs to the “Cristo El Salvador” [Christ the Savior] communal bank, which is comprised of six members and she is president.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Gilma

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil y le colabora con los gastos del hogar. María se dedica a la comercialización de tienda desde hace dos años. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida van saliendo adelante. Hace algunos meses comenzó a construir su vivienda pero por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar,  razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para dar fin a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 49, lives in her own house with her life partner.  He is a bricklayer, and he contributes to the household expenses.  María has been selling from her store for two years.  This is the way she earns a living.  She and her life partner are getting ahead together.

Some months ago she started to build her house.  However, due to the lack of financial resources, she has not managed to finish it.  That is the reason she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to finish her house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 41-year-old taxi owner in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a father of four whose spouse is a housewife. He has been in this business for the last six years and is doing well.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to service his taxi car and to give it a new look. He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to own a bus in future.

loans.use: to service his taxi car and give it a new look.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 34-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy books, pens, and paper to sell. 

Being charged with the responsibility of looking after her family, she started this business. 

Her challenge is limited capital and seasonal income. When schoolchildren are gone for the holidays, she is unable to earn income. 

However, her vision is to educate her children. Harriet intends to use the loan to buy more books, pens, and pencils to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, and pencils to sell.

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
Jessica es una señora de 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad con un clima agradable, conocida también por ser una zona muy comercial y productiva.
Jessica trabaja junto con su esposo todas las tardes, ellos elaboran muebles y artesanías de bambú, hacen entregas dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Este arte la aprendió de su suegro quien anteriormente tenía este taller, pero falleció y les dejó esta herencia. Ellos dedican 5 horas todos los días a esta labor que la hacen con todo el amor del mundo.
Jessica acudió a Fundación Alternativa por buenas referencias, visitó la agencia para recibir información y le gustó mucho el servicio brindando. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución y con Kiva ya que gracias a este crédito podrá comprar más bambú que está de oportunidad y así poder realizar más artículos y venderlos para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 34, lives with her husband and their four children in her own house in Santo Domingo de los Colorados.  It is a city with a pleasant climate, and it is known for being a very commercial and productive area.

Jessica works with her husband every afternoon.  They make furniture and handicrafts from bamboo.  They make deliveries within and outside of the city.  She learned this art from her father-in-law, who previously had a workshop.  However, he passed away, and he left them this legacy.  They spend five hours every day on this work.  They work with all of the love in the world.

Jessica came to the Fundación Alternative because of its good reputation.  She visited the agency in order to get information, and she really liked the  service provided.  She is very grateful to the institution and to Kiva.  Thanks to this loan she will be able to buy more bamboo that is on sale.  This way she will make more items and sell them in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to make more items.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a new client who has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX. He is married with two children and lives in a rural area in Buyanja sub-county. He lost his parents at an early age so he did not complete school. He therefore started business early. He first started by mobilizing money from agriculture activities and then later he bought a motorcycle for  transporting  people and goods. He has now settled down to a retail shop. His major challenges have been lack of capital, fluctuating demand and poor business location. He hopes that with this loan, he will expand his business and be able to relocate to town where he can do wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Karoli

texts.en: Karoli is a 48-year-old married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of maize plus coffee. He also carries out farming to get extra income to enable him to earn a living. He is faced with a hardship of constant price fluctuations of agricultural products. His dream is to buy more land for farming. Karoli has asked for a loan to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Jamalat

texts.en:
Jamalat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Jamalat is a 33-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and five kids; one son and four daughters in a small simple house. Jamalat's husband works as an employee in the public sector and has a low income. This income is barely covers the family's needs. He also works on his farm where he plants seasonal crops using green houses to ensure he has a good quality. 

Jamalat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Jamalat's husband can increase his productivity and income and also improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her husband's farm.

loans.name: Khosiyatkhon

texts.en:
Khosiyatkhon is 42 years old. She is married and has three children in school. 

She is a teacher and has worked in a school for more than six years. She is a kind and hardworking employee of the school. 

Her husband is also works in the school as a janitor. 

Khosiyatkhon has a car which has broken. She must repair her car, but she does not have the money. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to repair her car. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair her car

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar was born in the year 1960. She is married and has children. Her children are adults. She lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan. She sells candies, chocolates and biscuits. Munavvar has been busy with this business for more than 20 years. She has a selling place in a local market. Her selling place is 2 meters. 

She wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy candies, chocolates and other things. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy candies, chocolates and other things to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is from Iraq. He is a 45-year-old married client, who has four children. Jawad is the sole provider for the family.

Jawad owns a small shop where he sells accessories. He has been in this field since his childhood and has gained good experience in this field.  In 2006, Jawad established his own business and it started to grow fast. His fame spread all over the area thanks to the good quality and variety of his selling goods.

Jawad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. In the future, Jawad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to take a better care of his family by providing them a better income.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
Eva, vive junto a su madre de 72 años y dos hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad, para tener ingresos con los cuales cubrir las necesidades de su hogar se dedica a vender lácteos en su casa también lo hace de manera ambulante, es una actividad que realiza todos los días.
Con el crédito comprara variedad de tipos de quesos, crema, cuajada, etc., con lo que tendrá producto suficiente para surtir la demanda que tiene de sus clientes, espera mejorar la calidad de los lácteos que vende y aumentar sus ventas.
Sueña con mantener la ayuda que da a su familia así como de igual forma continuar apoyando en sus estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eva lives with her 72-year-old mother and her two children (ages 10 and 17).  In order to have income for covering household necessities, Eva sells dairy products from her home and also as a street vendor.  She works at her business every day.  The loan will be used to buy a variety of cheeses, cream, curds, and other products.  This will give her sufficient inventory for meeting the demand from her customers.  Eva hopes to improve the quality of the dairy products that she sells so that she can increase her sales.  

She dreams of maintaining the support she provides for her family as well as continuing the help she gives to her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cheeses, cream, curds, and other products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old woman with two children, aged 7 and 3 years old, whom she supports. 

This is her second loan of KES 50,000. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund officer. 

She has a café business. Her business is located at Ngala Phase 3. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 11,500.

She is planning to use the loan to purchase more stock for her business. She will use the profit to expand the business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 42 years old. He is from Nyandarua South and is married to Lavina. They have two children aged 10 and 18 years old. 

Paul is a farmer and has been in it for many years.  He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm. Paul is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan. He will use the profits made to rent more farm land and plant cabbages, baby carrots, baby corn etc. for export.

He hopes to diversify into dairy farming, poultry and bee-keeping in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Katojo Tukore Group

texts.en:
Angella is a married woman of 42 years. She has four children who all attend school, and together they reside in Kanyeganyegye, a rural cell in Rukungiri district.

Angella deals in agriculture, basically crop husbandry and banana planting. She is a hardworking woman, and in addition to the crops, she rears cows to generate more income for her large family. 

She has requested a loan from UGAFODE through her group to buy fertilizers to improve the productivity of her bananas and increase her profits in the long run. 

All the group members expect to improve their income through the loans that they are each requesting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 33 years old and married, with four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Rosalina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a rake, vegetable seeds, a garden hose, gloves, and a shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Rosalina will use the profits from her sales to improve her house and save some in her saving account for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a rake, vegetable seeds, a garden hose, gloves, and a shovel

loans.name: Aifaanuu

texts.en:
Aifaanuu is 49 years old amd married, with seven children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Aifaanuu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, and a pickaxe. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Aifaanuu hopes to save more in her saving account to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, and a pickaxe

loans.name: Santos Ceferino

texts.es: Santos de 27 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Santos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés en su casa de habitación. Santos es muy conocido en la zona como un hombre responsable quien hace toso lo que este a su alcance para ganarse la vida y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones. Santos desea invertir en su panadería por lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración del pan, tales como: harina y un cilindro para hacer el pan francés.
texts.en:
27-year old Santos lives in his own house together with his wife and two children aged 5 and 2. He earns his living making and selling French bread in his house. He is well known throughout the area as a responsible man who does everything he can to earn money and provide his children a better standard of living.

Santos wishes to invest in his bakery so he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy the ingredients necessary for making bread such as flour and a cylindrical-shaped mould for the French bread.

loans.use: buy flour and a cylindrical-shaped mould for French bread.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny has done great with her poultry business and has opened a third business, water-vending. She has managed to secure a big water tank to store water for her poultry as well as sell to the neighbors given the scarcity of this commodity in the area.

This marks her seventh loan and she plans to purchase a motor bike which will help her to supply her products to the butchery near her and get there on time. She hopes to be a successful business lady in her village.

loans.use: to purchase  a motor bike for deliveries.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 44-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four, and his spouse is a housewife. For the past twenty years, he has been in this business and doing great.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase shop stock of washing detergents, sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk, and cooking fat.

The anticipated profit will be used to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase shop stock of washing detergents, sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jardín Esperanza Group

texts.es: Felipe, quien aparece a la derecha de la fotografía de lentes y polera rayada azul con verde, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Jardín Esperanza de Lota. En este Banco Comunal los socios tienen diversos rubros tales como la venta de ropa, negocios de abarrotes, librerías, panadería y tarjeterías. Felipe vende sushi, comenzó hace un año con amigos haciendo sushi para ellos hasta que se les ocurrió poder vender para tener más dinero, fue así como empezaron a vender, es por esto además que uno de sus próximos desafíos es poder tener su negocio establecido. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar más insumos y una maquina conservadora de alimentos. Durante este último tiempo le ha ido muy bien con las ventas es por esto que requiere lo antes posible el dinero ya que así podrá seguir vendiendo sus ricos sushis. Felipe cuenta que lo que más le gusta de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es poder acceder de manera fácil al crédito.
texts.en: In the photo, Felipe appears on the right, wearing glasses and a blue and green striped shirt.  He belongs to the “Jardín Esperanza de Lota” communal bank where members have diverse businesses such as clothing sales, grocery stores, bookstores, bakeries, and card stores.  Felipe sells sushi.  A year ago, he began making sushi for his friends until it occurred to them that they could sell their product to make extra money. This was how they began to sell, and one of his next challenges is being able to set up his business.   He will use the funds he is requesting to purchase more supplies and a freezer.  Sales have been going very well lately, and for this reason, he needs the funds as soon as possible so that he can continue selling his delicious sushi.  Felipe says that what he likes the most about working with “Fondo Esperanza”, is being able to easily access credit.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and a freezer.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de cafetín, el cual ha logrado un negocio estable y rentable. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo invertir y empezar con este tipo de negocio, para obtener otra entrada de ingresos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: caramelos, azúcar, vasos, servilletas entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer productos que solicita su clientela. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá obtener ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en otro negocio y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Flor is originally from the city of Granada. She is engaged in the cafe business and has a stable and profitable business. 

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito as she could invest and open this type of business in order to have another path to income.

She is asking for a new loan in order to buy: candies, sugar, glasses, napkins and more, in order to be able to provide the products that her customers request. She thinks that the loan will be beneficial as she will be able to obtain earnings in order to continue investing in another business and have more income.

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, sugar, glasses, napkins, and other items.

loans.name: Murtada

texts.en:
Murtada is 29 years old. He is an Iraqi youth client, who is single and lives with his parents and his brothers. Murtada helps his father in providing the family living. 

Murtada owns a big motor generator and provides his neighborhood with electricity. He has been in this business since 2010. Throughout his career, Murtada grew fast. He now has an employee and has gained a good reputation in his area. 

Murtada is requesting a $3,000 youth loan. This loan will help him buy and install a piece of equipment on his motor generator, which will increase the volume of electrical energy that his motor generator can provide. In the future, he is aiming to buy a new Eco-friendly motor generator, which is silent and doesn't disturb his surroundings.

loans.use: to buy and install a piece of equipment on his motor generator to increase the volume of electrical energy that his motor generator can provide.

loans.name: Abdul Kazem

texts.en:
Abdul Kazem is a married Iraqi who is 52 years old and the father of two children. He provides for his family by running a grocery store where he sells various products, including canned food, drinks, snacks and detergent. He established his business in 2010 and, thanks to his competitive prices, became well-known and developed an excellent reputation. 

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy a new refrigerator and to install new shelves in his grocery store. His goal is to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with higher living standards.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and to install new shelves in his grocery store.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul was born in the year 1975. She is a kind woman with a great desire to be a successful in life. She has been busy selling vegetables. She has been busy with this business for more than 10 years. Jumagul is the only food-provider for her family as she is divorced and has two children who aren't grown-up yet. 

Jumagul is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profit because she needs to make money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onion etc. She will improve her living conditions from the profit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build new greenhouses for her farm.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hard-working married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He also carries out welding to earn extra income. He went into business so as to eradicate poverty. However, he is limited by capital, seasonal changes and price fluctuations which reduce his output and income.

His dream is to expand his business into new market areas. Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Itahiro Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Wilson is a Ugandan aged 50 who is married and has seven children who are all attending school in Kagadi, Uganda. He is an agriculturist dealing in poultry farming and also does crop farming. He works hard to satisfy the growing family needs and educate all his children but suffers from limited capital in his business. 

He hopes to see all his children educated and to buy more land for farming. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan. Wilson has asked for a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, etc. desde hace varios años, posee clientela que la buscan y la prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Carmen está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería por mayor y así poder surtir mas la tienda  para atender mejor a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su compañero de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. 

She has owned a little store for several years where she sells basic necessities such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, etc. She has customers that look for her and prefer her because of the good prices and the friendly customer service. With the money she gets from the sales she is able to cover some of the household expenses. 

Carmen is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies in bulk and thus be able to supply her store and be able to better assist her customers and obtain better profits in order to have a better quality of life with her life partner.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Faasu

texts.en: Faasu is 44 years old and married with six children. She would like to start a small business sewing clothes in her community. In order to do this, Faasu needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads, materials, and oil. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads, materials, and oil.

loans.name: Ausiva

texts.en: Ausiva is 35 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Ausiva has requested a loan to buy a canoe, fishing net, fishing gear, and spear. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ausiva will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a canoe, fishing net, fishing gear, and spear.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is 22 years old and is married with three children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Temukisa has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, salts, onions, a large cooking pot, and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Temukisa will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salts, onions, a large cooking pot, and a new oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of men's and ladies' footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a room inside her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock such as seasonal fruit, fish, candy, cakes etc.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old, married man from a small village, near Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and five children, four sons and one daughter, in a small, simple house. Khaled works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also works as a farmer on his land where they plant seasonal fruits and vegetables, using greenhouses to ensure they have good quality. 

Khaled took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy fertilizer for his farm. By taking this loan, Khaled can improve his farm, increase his productivity, and also improve the family's living conditions. Khaled appears in the photo, on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong was born in 1954. Her husband passed away. She has 3 children, all of whom have been married. Hong has been a farmer for 30 years. Her monthly income is only about VND 2,000,000.  Her dream is having enough money to build a new house.  Thus, to raise more income for her family, besides growing crops, Hong raises chickens and pigs to sell eggs and meat. However, she is facing the problem of capital shortage to invest in her farming business. Consequently, she would like to participate in this credit program to solve her financial difficulty. Hong has been a member of SEDA since 2006. This time, she would like to borrow VND 10,682,000 to buy piglets, chicks and animal fodder. Her profits from her business will be used to fulfill her dream, which is owning a new house. 
Other members of Hong's  group are:
•	Xuyen is a 49 years old businesswoman. She has 2 children. She would love to borrow VND 7,630,000 to buy more fruits for her fruit shops.
•	Sau is 54 years old. She is a distiller. She wants to borrow VND 11,118,000 to invest in her distillation workshop.
•	Mai is a 47 years old businesswoman. She would like to borrow VND 10,246,000 to restocking her grocery shop.
•	Hanh is 39 years old. She has 2 children. She wants to borrow 10, 246,000 to finance her family business, which is a clothes shop.
•	Thanh is 28 years old. She has 2 children. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 to invest in her fish shop in a local market.
•	Ngoc is 36 years old. She has 2 children. Similar to Hong, Ngoc, she wants to borrow VND 7,630,000 for raising poultry. 
•       Ton is 63 years old. She has 2 children. She would love to borrow VND 11,118,000 VND to invest in her breakfast restaurant

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks, and animal fodder

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 40 years old and married, with two children. She assists her husband in earning her family's income. 

Since 2006, Fatima has operated a small grocery store where she sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. She has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. Fatima has an excellent reputation. 

Fatima is requesting a USD 2,400 loan to install a new display window for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to increase her business and her profits to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to install a new display window for her grocery store.

loans.name: Atoa

texts.en: Atoa is 62 years old with two children. She runs a small business selling drinks in her community and has been doing this for two years. Atoa has requested a loan to buy flavor mixtures, sugar, empty bottles and a new freezer. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Atoa will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flavor mixes, sugar, empty bottles and a new freezer.

loans.name: Heliodora

texts.es: Heliodora de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieto, ella se dedica  a la venta de refrescos como: jugos, agua, gaseosas, etc. desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela pues son productos muy vendibles y los da a buenos precios, Heliodora esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar mas refrescos por mayor y asi poder aumentar sus ganancias y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Heliodora is 62 years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter and grandson. 

She makes a living by selling beverages like juice, water, soft drinks, etc. For many years, her business has been located in her home. She has many customers because her products are very well-sold and she offers them at good prices.

Heliodora is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase more beverages in bulk so that she can increase her earnings and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase juice, water, soft drinks, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Ilcia Noemy

texts.es: Ilicia de 33 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, dicho negocio es muy importante ya que con los ingresos que percibe su esposo no logran cubrir los gastos del hogar. por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una galera para ordenar los materiales y así sea más fácil el proceso para la venta. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Ilicia, who is 33 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their 4 children, who are in school. She makes a living by purchasing and selling scraps. Her business is very important because her husband's income does not cover their household expenses.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a shed to organize her materials so it will be easier to process and sell them. With the loan, she will purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build a shed.

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto
