texts.es: Jorge de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 3 años de edad, el posee un pequeña librería en su lugar de habitación desde hace 2 años, posee mucha clientela, que lo prefieren por la calidad de los productos, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, obtiene buenas ganancias especialmente en los meses de diciembre y julio que es cuando empiezan las clases, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor como: cuadernos de diferentes números, lapiceros, lápices, colores, crayolas, plumones, papelería de diferentes color, etc. y poder surtir aun mas su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder le dar su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 32 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. He had a small bookstore in his home for 2 years. He has many customers and they prefer his store for the quality of the products, the good prices, and his friendly service.

He earns good money, especially in July and December, which is when classes start. With his earnings, he has been able to pay for household expenses.

Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise like notebooks, pens, pencils, colored pencils, crayons, felt-tip pens, different colors of paper, etc. so that he will be able to stock his business, which his his only source of income, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, pencils, colored pencils, crayons, felt-tip pens, different colors of paper, etc.

loans.name: Juana Cecilia

texts.es: Juana de 40 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la comercialización de ropa para damas y caballeros lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con esposo, Juana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor y poder surtir aun mas su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de  trabajo y así ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old. For the past 6 years, she has been selling women's and men's clothing by walking to different areas near her home. She has many customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices. With the money that she earns, she is able to pay for household expenses.

She lives in her own home with her husband. Juana is requesting a loan to purchase clothing in bulk so that she will be able to stock her business more, since it is her only source of income. This way, her and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Faaifo is a 38 year old woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows varieties of vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faaifo has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, shovels, gloves and mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Faaifo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, wheel barrow, shovels, gloves and mist blower.

loans.name: Alonso Danilo

texts.es: Alonso de 32 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Él se dedica a la críanza y venta de ganado. Es un hombre muy trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo va sacando a su hijo adelante. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio de ganado para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar un ternero para criarlo y luego venderlo. Espera poder tener resultados positivos con la inversión para así poder ir mejorando su negocio como sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alonso is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his 7-year-old son, who is studying at the local school. 

He makes a living by raising and selling cattle. He is a hardworking man who, with much effort, is moving his son forward. With the goal of improving his income, he has made the decision ton invest in his cattle business, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase a calf, which he will raise and later sell.

He hopes to have positive results from the loan so that he can continue to improve his business and his income.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Angel Patricio

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 37   años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Urdaneta  Provincia de Los Ríos. 


Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra  de insumos agrícolas. Las compras realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener una buena producción. Los desafíos que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades falta de capital para trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con sus padres.
texts.en:
Ángel is 37 years old, single, and has two children.  He lives with his parents in the canton of Uradaneta in Los Ríos Province.  

Ángel is a member of the Communal Bank "Palmasola", which is located in the neighborhood of Palmasola in the parish of Ricaurte, canton of Urdaneta.  The members are farm workers and livestock breeders.

Ángel is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies.  His purchases are conducted in the city of Ventanas.  His wish is to remain healthy so that he can continue working and have a good production.  The challenges he faces include dealing with pests and diseases, as well as lacking operating capital.  

In his free time, Ángel enjoys spending time with his parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with eight children. Lorna is 47 years old and lives in San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

She owns mango trees and sells mangos to earn a living. She has had this business for 27 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25,000 to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies

location.town: Liloy-San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of 46 years, married to Evaline, and a father of three children. He runs a general store and has been in this business for 14 years now. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This will be Peter's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire amount to pay for school fees for his children. He wants to educate his children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Chickey

texts.en:
Chickey is a 21-year-old single woman who has had a small lawn mowing business for many years.

Chickey needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, oil and safety gears. She will use her profits to provide for her family's everyday needs and assist with her business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, oil and safety gears.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo quien es menor de edad y aun no estudia. Ella es agricultora y comerciante ya que en su casa de habitación tiene una pequeña pulperia y un molino para quebrar maíz con lo que genera ingresos para apoyar la economía en su hogar. Su grado de estudio es de primaria completa la cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres. En el trabajo de campo únicamente su esposo se involucra ya que ella tiene que atender la pulperia y el molino y solo para la temporada de corte de café ella se involucra. Su negocio de pulperia tiene 3 años de trabajarlo siendo sus clientes los mismos habitantes de la comunidad entre otros que llegan a la zona como los intermediarios para la compra de café.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, entre otros insumos ya que los pocos ingresos que ella genera por parte del negocio del molino y la pulperia no son los suficientes para la compra de estos insumos.
Sus metas y sueños dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, oportunidad de estudiar y que se convierta en un profesional con mejores oportunidades en la vida y en el entorno social. Sus metas reparar su casa de habitación la cual necesita mejoras como repello, un piso digno, entre otros que ayudaran a que su familia se sienta mejor y más cómoda.
texts.en:
Doña María is 36, married, and the mother of a young son who has not yet started school. She completed primary school thanks to the moral and financial support of her parents. Doña María is a farmer and shopkeeper who runs a small grocery store in her home as well as a mill for grinding corn. These two businesses provide income that helps meet the family's expenses. Doña María has run the shop for three years. Her customers are residents of her community as well as people who visit the area, such as wholesale coffee buyers. Doña María's husband takes care of the farm by himself as she has to run the shop and the mill. She only works on the farm during the coffee harvest. 

Doña María has applied for a loan from the COMIXMUL Cooperative for the purchase of fertilizers (some of them foliar, or absorbed through leaves), manure, and other supplies. The income from the shop and the mill aren't enough to purchase these supplies. 

Doña María's goals and dreams include providing a better life for her son. She wants the boy to have the opportunity to study and become a professional with better chances in life and in society. Doña María also wants to make some repairs to her home, which needs plaster, a decent floor, and some other improvements to provide her family greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the care of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Nely de 39 años de edad es casada y madre de 5 hijos quienes viven con ella y su esposo y aun dependen de ella ya que 4 de ellos estudian y al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayudan a su padre en las diferentes actividades del campo. Doña Nely tiene un grado de estudio primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de café y hace unos meses ella aprendió a elaborar pan de casa para la venta gracias a su madre quien es comerciante y agricultora. Su esposo a parte de la agricultura también tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería siendo sus clientes vecinos, familiares  y amigos. El terreno donde está sembrado el café esta atrás de su casa de habitación por lo que esto le permite estar más al pendiente de su plantación y de su asistencia.   
Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para poder asistir un cultivo de hortaliza que sembrara permitiendo abonar la tierra, limpiarla y dar la preparación necesaria para obtener una buena cosecha.
Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que sus cultivos de café y hortalizas manteniendo el grano sano ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura y poder cumplir con su compromiso de pago. Su sueño es como el de toda madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y lograr enviarlos a la universidad para que pueda graduarse y ser unos profesionales con excelencia y preparación con mejores oportunidades en la vida y en donde quiera que vayan.
texts.en:
Nely is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children who live with her and her husband and still depend on her. Four of them go to school, and after school help their father in the various farm activities.

Nely has completed one grade of primary school, which she was able to take, thanks to the support of her parents. It was they who taught her to grow coffee. 

Currently she grows coffee, and a few months ago learned to make homemade bread to sell, thanks to her mother who is a vendor and farmer. Her husband, besides farming, also has a small carpentry workshop. His customers are his neighbors, family members and friends. 

The parcel planted with coffee is behind their home, so this allows her to keep an eye on her plantation and its maintenance. Currently she has requested a loan from the Comixmul cooperative to buy manure, coffee formula fertilizer, other fertilizers, herbicides, foliar sprays and other supplies. This is so she can maintain a vegetable crop that she will plant, allowing her to fertilize the land, clear it, and do the necessary preparation to obtain a good harvest. 

Her plans are to improve and fertilize the land they cultivate, so that their coffee and vegetable crop stay healthy. This way they will be able to have a secure harvest and be able to meet their payment commitment. 

Like any mother, her dream is to help her children with their education, and manage to send them to university so that they can graduate and be excellent, trained professionals, with better opportunities in life and wherever they go.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to prepare the land for her vegetable and coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Laieng's Group

texts.en:
Laieng, aged 55, is living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khum district, and has six children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing watermelon. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support the family.

Laieng has just begun with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a water-pumping machine for supporting her paddy business. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a water-pumping machine for supporting her paddy business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Vinh, 53, has four children in total. 

Vinh has been farming rice, while her husband is a fisherman. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Vinh is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. 

She hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида проживает в Спитаменском районе. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. У Умиды дружная семья.  Она очень общительная, добрая женщина. Умида работает в мел комбинате Спитаменского района. Она ответственно относиться к своей работе. В свободное время от работы Умида занимается шитьем. Её с детство привлекало к вышиванию, она с любовью шьет национальные платья для соседок. Соседки очень довольны Умидой и рады что у них имеется такая соседка рукодельница. Старший сын Умиды работает в Р.Ф, но его работа там сезонная. На зиму он приезжал к родителям в отпуск. У сына Умиды скоро заканчивается отпуск и он должен уехать обратно в Россию, но в данное время у Умиды не хватает немножко денег для покупки авиа билета. Умида обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. На полученные деньги она хотела бы купить сыну авиа билет. Умида очень надеется на поддержку организации и выражает благодарность за оказанною помощь.
texts.en: Umida is married, has three children, and lives in the Spitamen district. She has a close-knit family and is a very sociable, kind woman. She works in the Spitamen flour mill and is a responsible worker. Umida sews clothing in her spare time. She has been interested in embroidery since childhood and lovingly sews traditional dresses for her neighbors, who are very pleased and excited to have a seamstress in the neighborhood. Her eldest son works seasonally in Russia and came back to visit his parents for vacation this winter. His vacation will be over soon and he will have to go back to Russia, but Umida does not have quite enough money to buy a plane ticket. She applied for a loan with MDO Arvand so that she can buy him the ticket. She has high hopes for support and is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for her son

loans.name: Bonface Masita's Group

texts.en: Bonface is a young father from a slum called Kawangware.  Due to the lack of job opportunities in the area, he has experienced long periods of unemployment and struggled to find a decent wage to provide for his family.  Like Bonface, the rest of the group reside in similar areas and strive to lead a better quality of life.  They all aspire to becoming self-sufficient business owners and are currently selling energy-efficient products like solar lamps and ful-efficient cookstoves to improve their busiess skills and earn a decent wage.  The group will use the loan to buy more stock so they can earn a decent wage and lead better quality lives.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng is a local borrower from Kompong Cham province. She is 39 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she has been farming cassava as the main source of income and working as a paid worker during her spare time to earn additional income. Her cassava business earns her 20,800 KHR per day. 

In her group of three, she and one co-borrower are second-cycle borrowers. The remaining borrower is a fourth-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she repaid with success has enabled her to support her cassava farming by timely paying a weeding fee and permitting her to provide decent meals for her children. Now, she is a leader of her group consisting of three. They are requesting a loan amount of 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee and to buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee and to buy insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a Ugandan female, aged 30 years. She is married, with three children and she has a liquor store where sells a local brew, commonly known as Waragi. She has been in this business for three years, having started with a produce store whose business she still maintains as her side source of income. 

Doreen hopes to finish her house, but she is challenged by competition and high license costs of local brew. 

Doreen is requesting a loan to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Anapela

texts.en:
Anapela is a 33-year-old single woman. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Anapela needs a loan to buy mixture flavor, sugar, foam cups and a new freezer. She plans to use her profits to support her family. 

Anapela has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy mixture flavor, sugar, foam cups and a new freezer.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en: Donozio, aged 31, is requesting another loan to buy agricultural produce, beans and maize. A retail shop owner, he decided to diversify his income with a produce business, as the retail shop is being managed by his wife. He also earns income from motorcycle transport in order to make ends meet.  Donozio is in need of a loan to buy beans and maize for resale. He dreams of buying a vehicle in future and educating his six children.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen is 37 years old and has a child who is a student in a local secondary school. Khen is a widowed mother and is an employee, working for an organization in Siem Reap province. She is able to earn a decent salary, which she normally uses to provide food for her family and to send her child to school.

Khen wants to improve her living conditions by having a safe latrine for use at home since she doesn't have one, yet. She will use this loan to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine and to pay for laborers performing the construction. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Khen is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine and to pay for laborers performing the construction.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad es una joven muy trabajadora, honrada y honesta, desde hace un año se dedica a la agricultura su principal cultivo es el maíz y frijol, adicional a eso posee una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en la siembra y sus dos hijos, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles  de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su siembra y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
This 25-year-old client is a very hardworking, honest, and trustworthy young woman. She has been a farmer for a year, growing mainly corn and beans. She sells her crops at various markets in the area where she lives, and also runs a small shop in her home. 

The income from the farm and the shop allow the client to meet her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her partner, who helps her plant crops and care for their two children. The client is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds, pest-control supplies, and other farming inputs. These purchases will allow her to continue her planting, boost her income, and provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, seeds,  pest-control supplies, and other farming inputs.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 29 years old from Nyandarua South and is married to Peris. They have two children: Mary who is five years old and Julius who is three years old. David has a retail shop that he has been running for the past year. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, bread, etc., to add to his stock. David will use the profits made from his business to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to give his children the best education in the near future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc., to add to his stock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34-years-old, married to John and together they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and two years old.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha which she has been running for five years.  She has applied for a second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy stock such as sugar, rice and flour, among other items, for her business after paying her previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest retail shop in the Kabati area in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Al Nahel Group

texts.en:
Iman, the featured borrower of Al Nahel group, got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Iman is shown on the far right side of the picture, (Fatima is the lady in the middle, and Souad is on the far left). Iman is 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has been working in the food sector for the past two years. She works with her husband in their butcher shop, and provides special services and care to their customers. Iman also sells sandwiches upon request from customers. This is an additional income she is working hard to develop. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a new car that she will use to transport large quantities of meat, in addition to charcoal for BBQ, and sandwiches requested.

Iman is very ambitious. She works hard to make sure that her children are well raised, and that the best standard of living is available to them. She would like to open a small restaurant in the future that will attract new customers and improve her family's living.

loans.use: To buy a car, which she will use to transport large quantities of meat, etc., for her butcher shop

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona is 24 years old. She is divorced. She has a little daughter, Zulaykho. Mijgona is a sewer. She learned about sewing national women's dresses from the best sewer in her region, and that’s why she sews wonderful dresses. She is the only provider for herself and her little daughter because her former husband doesn’t help her. Mijgona has been busy with sewing for more than 5 years. She has her regular customers. 

Mijgona wants to buy a new sewing machine because she has an old sewing machine which was given to her by her mother. She is asking for a loan of 800 USD to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 56 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is a widow. She has one grown up child who is 38 years old.

Tabitha has a green grocery business that she has been running for three years now. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy vegetables, onions, tomatoes, etc. to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to improve her family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 33 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta de ropa para damas lo hace de forma ambulante por la diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar  vive en casa propia con sus esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, Rafael está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y surtía mas su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Rafael is 33 years old and for seven years has been selling women's clothing. He does this door to door as a street vendor around the various neighborhoods located near his home. With what he obtains in earnings, he manages to cover some of his household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 4. 

Rafael is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing at wholesale and stock his business more, as that is his only source of income. This way he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life, without any limitations.

loans.use: To buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 11 años quien estudia en la escuela pública de su localidad. Ana se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón y de maní el cual comercializa de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. De esta forma junto a su esposo llevan la economía de su hogar y tratan de dar a su hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Desea mejorar las ventas de su negocio por lo que se acercó a las instalaciones de FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en la compra mayor cantidad de maní y semilla de maraño para la venta y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 and lives in her own home with her husband and their 11-year-old son, who attends the public school in their town. Ana goes around the main sections of her town selling peanuts and cashews. This business allows Ana and her husband to meet their household expenses. The couple is striving to provide a better life for their son. 

Ana aspires to boost sales, so she went to the offices of FUSAI [Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to apply for a loan to invest in the purchase of more peanuts and cashews to sell. This additional inventory will allow Ana to meet the growing demand in her market.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanuts and cashews.

loans.name: Al Kanaa Group

texts.en:
Nadima is the featured borrower of the Al Kanaa group, which consists of three ambitious ladies who put so much effort into developing their lives, and this was proven through the acquired loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. The three members have been friends for a long time and they trust each other.

Nadima is the lady at the center of the picture. She is a 52-year-old married woman who has been working at selling Brazilian gold for fifteen years. She used to work as a housekeeper, but her health isn't good enough for such a business, which made her turn to another business that doesn't need physical strength.

She is well known in her region because of the good quality products she sells and the encouraging prices she sets. With the acquired loan, she will increase her business merchandise with a newly released special collection that will attract new customers and satisfy current ones, especially for the coming valentine's day.

As for the other group members, Konouh is the lady at the far right side of the picture and Hanaa is the first on the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a newly released special collection that will attract new customers and satisfy current ones, especially for the coming valentine's day.

loans.name: Bibimukarama

texts.en: Bibimukarama is a highly educated person. She is married and has 3 daughters, Munisa, Anisa and Munira. Her husband is a teacher. He works at the university. Bibimukarama is the director of a kindergarten. She has worked there for more than 6 years. Bibimukarama is a smart and intellectual person, who always works for the well being of her children. She wants to buy a computer for them. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy a computer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her children.

loans.name: Majidu

texts.en:
Majidu and the UGAFODE Microfinance Limited credit officer (in red) are pictured in the client's store.

Majidu is applying for a loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, so that he can take advantage of the harvest season and buy in bulk, cheaply. He is a farmer as well as a trader in agricultural produce. 

He hopes that if he buys in bulk, he will be able to sell to schools since they are opening soon for first term. This will help Majidu to increase his profits and, thereby, adequately meet his family's needs. He is hard-working and always looks for opportunities to increase his income sources.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: René de 55 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, adicional a eso también siembra jocote cuando es la temporada, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, René está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. para poder seguir con su siembra y obtener mejores ganancias para darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
René is 55 years old, and he has been engaged in agriculture for 15 years, planting corn and beans. On top of this he also plants jocote* when the season is right. He sells his products to brokers who buy and sell basic grains, and thanks to the money he earns from his sales he succeeds in paying for some of hi household’s expenses. René is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds and blight control products in order to keep on planting his crops, thus earning a better income to improve his standard of living.

<cite>*A species of flowering plant in the cashew family, Anacardiaceae, native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is most commonly known as Jocote, which derives from the Nahuatl word “xocotl”, meaning "fruit."</cite>

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, seeds and blight control products.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, posee mucha clientela pues tiene mucha variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja de albañil logran salir adelante en su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, Sandra desea mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico ya que solamente tiene pavimentado, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir dicho gastos por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar cemento, arena, cerámica y pago de mano de obra para poder tener mejor su vivienda y su familia puedan vivir más cómodo y en lo aseado.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has had a store in her home for the past five years. She has many clients as she has a good variety of products. With the profits she makes and with what her husband contributes from his work as a bricklayer they manage to pay the household expenses.

Sandra wants to improve their home, putting in ceramic tile flooring as it is now just concrete. But with what she earns she can't pay for it .So she has requested a loan to buy cement, sand and tiles and to pay for labor to improve her house. Her family will be able to live more comfortably in their newly finished home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, tiles and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингуль 62 года, вдова, одна воспитала 2 детей. Дети подрабатывают на частных стройках. У Эркингуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эркингуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 18,000 сом KGS. У Эркингуль имеется большой опыт работы в сфере сельского хозяйства, в хозяйстве имеются все условия для содержания скота. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Эркингуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, а также Эркингуль со своими детьми обрабатывают 3,60 ГА земельной доли. В основном сеет пшеницу, ячмень, сажает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркингуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эркингуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома для сына.
texts.en: Erkingul is 62 years old, a widow who raised two children on her own. Her children work in construction. Erkingul has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry, a business Erkingul started 23 years when she bought 18,000 KGS worth of cattle. Erkingul has extensive experience in agriculture, and her farm has all the facilities necessary for livestock. Her children actively help on the farm. Because of Erkingul's hard work, her farm currently boasts three milk cows, one horse, and a 3.60 hectare land share that she works with her children. They primarily sow wheat, barley, and potatoes. Her monthly income is 15,500 KG. In order to further develop her farm, Erkingul approached the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy cattle for breeding. Erkingul plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding her livestock, and she plans to save enough money to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Parsapiyio

texts.en:
Parsapiyio is 64 years old, married to Sidio and supports a family of six. He has been a maize farmer for the last twenty years, earning a monthly income of about KES 25,000. 

He is servicing a fifth loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund which he intends to use to pay for land cultivation and to purchase farm supplies. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. Parsapiyio's dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra, a sus 27 años de edad vive con su pareja y actualmente está esperando su primer hijo, que está próximo a nacer.
Hace varios meses comenzó a trabajar de manera indepediente, impulsada por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; por ello montó una venta de shots y cócteles en un carrito ambulante que ubica en una esquina del barrio donde reside; trabaja con el apoyo de una empleada todos los días de 6 pm a 1 am y así ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar algunas de las necesidades básicas en su hogar.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de otro carrito e insumos (licores y mezcladores), esto le permitirá poner otra sucursal de su negocio en un barrio aledaño y así mejorar las ventas, especialmente en esta temporada decembrina; lo que le permitirá generar mejores ingresos para poder solventar los gastos del nacimiento de su hijo. Actualmente manifiesta que enfrenta un desafío con su negocio, ya que pronto tendrá que dejarlo en manos de la empleada porque tendrá que retirarse para el nacimiento de su bebé; sin embargo tiene la ventaja de que su colaboradora es una persona de total confianza.
Sandra sueña con tener su negocio en un local comercial abierto al público, en el que pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y poco a poco mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, at 27 years old, lives with her husband and is expecting her first child, who will be born soon.

Several months ago she began working independently, motivated by the need to generate income to help her husband with the financial responsibilities of their home. For this purpose, she opened a shots and cocktails stand in a little wagon that she has located on a corner in her neighborhood.  She works every day from 6 p.m. to 1 a.m. with the support of a female employee, and this way she has generated enough income to afford some of the basic necessities for her home. 

She wants to invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of another wagon and supplies (liquor and mixes), which will allow her to open another branch of her business in an adjoining neighborhood and improve sales, especially during this holiday season.  This will allow her to generate more income so that she can afford the costs of her son’s birth.  

She says that currently she faces a challenge with her business because soon she will have to leave it in the hands of her employee, as she must retire for the birth of her baby. However, she has the advantage of having an assistant who is completely trustworthy. 

Sandra dreams of having her business in a commercial location that is open to the public, where she can serve her customers more comfortably and improve the profitability of her business, so that little by little, her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase another wagon and supplies (liquor and mixes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Kunyae

texts.en:
Kunyae is 45 years old and blessed with 5 children. He is a livestock trader in Narok County, Kenya, and has been running the business for the past 10 years, making a monthly income of about KES 20,000.

He has borrowed a first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, married to Kasaine and blessed with two children whom she supports. For the past twelve years she has operated a small shop and earns a good monthly income doing so.

Agnes is applying for a 70,000 KES loan through Vision Fund Kenya which she plans to use to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be reinvested in her shop as well as pay for school fees. Her desire is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old married father of two. He has worked in a body shop since leaving elementary school in order to help support his parents.

Ali began working in his current establishment in 2011. He is well known in his area for his expertise and good reputation. Business is good.

Ali is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy tools necessary to his trade so he can respond more quickly and effectively to customers' needs and requests.

Ali is working hard to make sure that his children won't face the obstacles and impoverished childhood he had. He is growing his business as quickly as he can to make sure he can provide them with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary to his trade

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 42 years old and from Nyandarua South; he is married. They have two children, ages 5 and 2. Samson is a farmer and has been in it for the past 15 years. 

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy seeds and pesticides to use on his farm. 

He is optimistic that his farm will do better after the loan. He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She owns a salon, and does farming for additional income.  

As a loving mother, she ventured into this business to meet the increasing demands of her family, especially the children.  However, she is affected by seasonal customers, but hopes to educate her children to university level.

Hellen is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Octavio tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad con un clima semitropical, ubicado sobre el valle de Zaña, que le ha permitido regar los cultivos de caña de azúcar y algodón, que pertenece a la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, desde hace tres años transportando a sus pasajeros por los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de una manera segura y generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Octavio is 57 years old. He lives together with his wife in the district of Cayaltí, which belongs to the city of Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock. It is located in the Zaña valley which enjoys a semi-tropical climate which allows the growth of sugar cane and cotton.

Octavio offers transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi. For the past three years he has been transporting people to the villages around his area. He is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle. In this way he can continue to offer his services in a safe way and generate money for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle buying replacement parts.

loans.name: Oidinakhon

texts.en:
Oidinakhon is widowed and has three children. For the past year and a half she has raised cattle. She and her children tend her ten cows in a cowshed which is attached to her house.

Oidinakhon works hard because she wants to grow her business and earn a good income. She is applying for a 5,000 TJS loan to buy more cattle. She needs money to provide her children with necessities and give them a good education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso is 38 years old; she is married and has two children. Her husband is a cook, and she has a pedagogical education. Bahriniso has worked more than 17 years in a kindergarten; she has great experience. She is one of the best employees of the kindergarten. 

Bahriniso and her family live in a house which is in bad condition.

Sheis asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. for repairing the house. 

This loan will help her to offer good living conditions for her family, and in this way brings moral stability to her family.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. for repairing the house

loans.name: Mujeres Independientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre Mujeres Independientes  se encuentra en el 2do. Ciclo del programa comités, tiene 22 integrantes actualmente, es un grupo que se caracteriza por ser solidario y muy activo, realizan actividades grupales para compartir, la mayor parte de sus integrantes cuentan con actividades comerciales .
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Gladys de 36 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos varios  desde hace varios años, la venta de sus productos lo realiza por toda la zona de Yaguarón, esta actividad es realizada  por todos los integrantes de la familia, ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar comestibles, jabones, aceites y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women, whose group bears the name "Mujeres Independientes," is in its second loan cycle of the communal bank program and currently has 22 members. It is a group noted for being supportive and very energetic, and they undertake shared group activities. The greater part of its members have businesses that involve sales. 

One of the stories worth highlighting is that of Gladys, 36. She has been buying and selling various products for several years. She sells her products throughout the Yaguarón area. This activity is carried on by all members of the family. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy foodstuffs, soap, cooking oil, and other items. This way she can continue selling.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soap, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 21 años de edad habita  en casa muy humilde junto a su grupo familiar. Juan se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a criar ganado para luego ponerlo a la venta. De esta forma espera obtener nuevos ingresos que le permitan dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una ternera para críarla y luego ponerla a la venta, expresa tener el terreno adecuado donde tendrá a la ternera. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento para comenzar su negocio lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juan, 21, lives in a very humble house with his family.  He earns a living by providing security services in a company located near his town.  He has decided to start raising cattle to later put up for sale.  In this way, he hopes to obtain new income that will allow him give his family better living conditions.
To carry out this project, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a calf to raise and later sell.  He says that he has land that is suitable for the calf.  He hopes to have access to this loan to start his business as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru: Зухре 33 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. У Зухры -среднее образование, после окончания школы вышла замуж. Зухра  имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Зухра в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2007 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Магазин у нее арендованный, реализует продукты питания. Благодаря упорному труду, Зухра смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Зухре расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зухра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку оптовых продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Зухре увеличить товарооборот в продуктовом магазине, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en: Zukhra is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Zukhra has a secondary education. After high school she got married. Zokhra neighbors think highly of her. They say she is a kind and hardworking woman. The family's primary source on income is Zukhra's grocery business, which she started in 2007 with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS. She rents her grocery shop. Because of her hard work, Zukhra has been able to develop and expand her business.  Her work brings in about 20,000 KGS per month, which covers food and the household needs of the family. Income from the business has allowed Zukhra to expand her business. In order to further expand her business, Zukhra approached the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy food wholesale to resell. The loan will help  Zukhra increase sales at the grocery store, and the profit will help her raise and educate her children in good living conditions.

loans.use: buy food wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Jamiiru

texts.en:
Jamiiru, 28, is married with two children who are attending school. He also takes care of his two nephews and pays for their school fees in a secondary school near his home. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

In 2005 Jamiiru began trading in coffee, beans, maize and matooke, or cooking bananas. He also does some farming. He works seven hours a day, six days a week. Jamiiru started in this business because it was easy to run, required less energy and yielded quick profits. The challenge he faces, however, is a steady fluctuation in prices.

Jamiiru is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy more produce to trade with clients in nearby cities. His future hope is to buy a motorcycle for his business so he can more easily transport his produce to market.

loans.use: to buy more produce to trade

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y su hijo, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para surtir mas su negocio y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 26 years old, and has been selling clothing for 2 years. 

She has her business in her place of residence, and she also sells on foot in the different markets that are near her home.  In this way she obtains her earnings, and with the help of her husband, she manages to pay for some of their household expenses. She lives in the house of a relative with her husband and her child. 

The client is seeking a loan to purchase clothing wholesale in order to supply her business more.  This way, she will be able to earn more and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Deysi Carolina

texts.es: Deysi de 33 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica como: pastelitos de carne, yuca frita, papas fritas, empanadas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Deysi está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para seguir con su negocio como: plátanos, maíz, verduras, yuca, papas, carne, etc. ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 33, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children.  She sells typical food like meat filled pastries, fried yucca, French fries, and ‘empanadas’ [stuffed pastries], etc.  Her business is located at her home.  She manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she gets from her sales.

Deysi is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue with her business.  She will buy things like bananas, corn, vegetables, yucca, potatoes, and meat, etc.  This is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to continue giving her family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy bananas, corn, vegetables, yucca, potatoes, and meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Naataesim

texts.en:
Naataesim is 74 years old. He has three wives and twenty children. For the past ten years he has worked his farm and done well. He has added to his flock of animals, which his children help him manage.

Naataesim has paid off two prior loans with VisionFund Kenya. With the help of these loans his monthly income has increased. He is now applying for a third loan of 45,000 KES which he will use to buy feed for his livestock and cultivate maize on his farmland.

With his loans Naataesim has been able to take care of all of his family's basic needs. He hopes to continue to be prosperous and a helpful man to society.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock and buy fertilizer for his maize crops

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 49-year-old married father of four children who established his current espresso coffee-selling business years ago.
He is the sole breadwinner for his family. It takes a lot of additional effort to expand his business and improve his family's living.

Jamal is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special coffee needs, in addition to plastic cups and many other business needs to meet the increasing number of customers.

This is Jamal's fifth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower; his previous loans helped him a lot in developing his family's living and covering almost all of their needs. 

Jamal used to work as a builder, but his physical situation isn't good enough to handle such hard work, which made him establish the current business.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups and special coffee needs for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidery by machine in his nearby town for many years. He has been recruiting skilled people for embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material to home for Salma, because she helps him with the embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art, and appreciate him for his efforts. 

He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses; that is why he wants to buy stock of thread, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls in various colors.

Salma requires some capital to buy desired inventory for her husband, but she does not have a sufficient amount. 

So that's why she made a humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. After getting this loan, her husband would be able to buy a stock of thread, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls in various colors.

Salma is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for an embroidery business

loans.name: Rosario De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rosario de 42 años de edad desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de joyería de enchape, comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad de sus productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposos y sus dos hijos, Rosario esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de joyería por mayor para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 42 years old and has been selling plated jewelry for 10 years. She sells as a street vendor in the various markets located near her home. She has a clientele because of the good prices and the quality of her products. 

With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay some household expenses. She lives in the home of a family member, with her husband and their two children. 

Rosario is requesting a loan so that she can buy jewelry at wholesale and continue with her work. This is her only source of income, and it enables her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy plated jewelry at wholesale.

loans.name: Santos Heriberto

texts.es: Santos de 47 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; Santos es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. Santos  tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Santos, age 47, lives with his life partner and their two children.  He has a metallic structure workshop where he makes doors, railings, and grilles, among others.  He has been in this business for several years.  He has a lot of experience that helps him improve his work each day.  

So far the business has given him very good results because he has gotten a lot of customers who seek him out for the quality of his work, the accessible prices, and, above all, because he always does the work to his customers’ liking.  Santos is a very hard-working, honest, and, above all, humble man.  He is always eager for new opportunities that will allow him to improve himself and be successful.

He wants to make the business grow, but he needs capital to buy material.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow him to buy iron, metal, and tools, etc.  Santos has good credit references.  He is sure that he will be able to repay the debt and bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45-year-old Palestinian refugee, living and working in Lebanon to provide for his beloved wife and four children. He is their sole breadwinner for the necessary standard of living.

Mohamad has a small carriage which he uses to move through the city streets and make sure that he will sell almost all of his merchandise.

Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to  increase his business merchandise with the special season's requested produce, which will increase his income and satisfy customers' needs.

This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He is hoping that through future loans, he will try to establish a stable fruit & vegetables selling shop, which will be a first step forward towards starting a wholesale trade.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special season's requested produce.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
A loan of 600 USD is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She is married and she has tree children and she has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fish, oils, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, water, and rice. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Teresa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, oils, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, water, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking energy package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) in order to save on the energy costs and cooking time.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is a mother of five children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages, to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and supplies for her food shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Serwari

texts.en:
Serwari is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling vegetables for many years. She is very enthusiastic and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for their food, health, and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy sacks of potatoes, onions, and carrots. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, onions, and carrots.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 23, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. 

Safia needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 24 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, and runs an iron welding workshop making windows and doors. He has been in the business for one year and has employed two people. He started working many years ago as worker on a daily cash wage with someone who had the same business. Then he worked hard to save money until he was able to open his own welding workshop. 

Hani describes his business environment as good because he is visited regularly by his customers. He has been able to improve his business. He has applied for 100,000 YER from AMB in order to  buy welding materials which will allow him to make windows and doors. In the future, he hopes to expand his business so that his profit will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to  buy welding materials which will allow him to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock in order to expand her sales.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the wholesale market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for thermally efficient cooking energy from LPG, so that he can manage his savings for the prospective future.

loans.name: Motia

texts.en: Motia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for the past five years. She has two cows and two buffaloes, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Motia has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Motia is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a father of three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. His main business is a hardware shop that he started to earn income to sustain his family. He is challenged by customers who don't pay on time but hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the hardware shop

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam, a hotel business owner, is a hardworking, married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She also does farming to supplement her income. She started a business to make ends meet, with what her husband earns. Her plan is to own a big and well-known restaurant in her area, and also to carry out an outside catering service.  She also plans to educate her children, but is challenged by limited capital for expansion. Zam will use the loan to buy furniture to use in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two medium-sized cows

loans.name: Taaj

texts.en: Taaj is a 53-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking gas so that she can switch from dirty fuels

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married Ugandan man aged 28 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children. He operates a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise and he also earns from agriculture, specifically from his piggery. He plans to finish construction of his residential house and educate his children though he is challenged by competition from similar businesses. Julius wants a loan to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise for sale.

loans.name: 3.05.95.07.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Tư is 47 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, because her child is grown up.

Tư has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. Tư has been involved in this business for more than ten  years.The main hardship that Tư faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Tư is the group leader of the 3.05.95.07.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members.  In 2012, Tư joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tư has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Tư hopes for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Virginia to improve her business.  She is married and she opened her second-hand business in 2009 with her own working capital.  She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like shirts (short and long-sleeve), trousers and shorts. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts (short and long-sleeve), trousers and shorts.

loans.name: 3.05.97.03.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Thủy is 40-years-old and she is married with two children.  Thủy is the group leader of the 3.05.97.03.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes that her business will do well to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.98.02.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Hà is 37-years-old and she is married with two children.  Hà is the group leader of the 3.05.98.02.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members.  She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hà has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.99.06.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Nga is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; another child is grown up.

Nga has a retail business selling animal feed. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to resell.

In 2011, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 3.14.99.06.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied petroleum gas, to avoid dirty fuel when they have their child later in the year

loans.name: Shaguta

texts.en:
Shaguta is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling cloth for the last two years. She purchases a variety of sorts of cloth from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Shaguta requested a loan of PKR 40.000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different sorts of cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different sorts of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 40-year-old married woman, and the mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a liquefied petroleum gas package in order to save the environment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for liquefied petroleum gas as an alternative energy in order to preserve the environment

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet their household expenses. 

Currently, Parveen has requested a loan of Rs. 60,000 to buy stock of rice and sugar, along with packs of flour.  It will help them to meet market demand consistently. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare. 

Shahnaz wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 28 years old; he lives in Ramallah with his wife and four children.

He opened a small workshop to work as a blacksmith in 2006. He specializes in manufacturing doors and windows; this business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Ahmad is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy a new machine for his workshop which will allow him to expand it and hire another laborer to help him because his customers arre constantly increasing.

Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his workshop which will allow him to expand it and hire another laborer to help him.

loans.name: Takasana

texts.fr: La cliente Takasana est une infirmière dans une structure médicale de la ville. Elle est parent d’1 étudiant et d’1élève inscrits régulièrement à l’université et à l’école primaire.
